loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 55 and married with nine children, with the last three still schooling. She has been in active farming in her hometown of Nyamira in South Rift, Kenya. Her farm produces tea, milk, beans, and bananas among others with all going to the local market.
Joyce has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the additional income will help her provide food and improve the general living standards of her family. In future she would like to run a cereal-grinding business in the local market.
She mentions high costs of farm inputs especially fertilizers as the major challenge in farming.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: St. Luke Bukinda Group

texts.en: Charles is 48 years old, married, and has four children aged between 9 and 24. He lives in his own permanent house in Hoima, Uganda. For eight years, Charles has been operating a retail shop and with the earnings from this business he has been able to build a permanent house. Charles faces the challenge of defaulters and price fluctuations. He hopes to grow his business to wholesale status. Charles is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loan.use: to buy sugar and soap for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, herbicides and other farm inputs.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Robert Ngugi

texts.en: Robert is a married man with four children aged between 18 and 26. He runs a tailoring services business in Nairobi specializing in making men's suits. He has been in this business for 23 years now and says his major challenge is financial constraints. Robert is using his loan of 20,000 KES to buy materials to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and open a shop specializing in selling materials for making clothes. He also hopes to take good care of his family and provide for all their needs. He describes himself as aggressive, determined and God-fearing.

loan.use: to purchase materials for his tailoring business.

loan.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 61 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Editha is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.
Editha has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling livestock.
She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for rice production.

loan.name: Jitahidi Msakuzi Group

texts.en:
Mwanahawa, who is in her early 30s, is a widow with two children who go to school. She has been running a grocery business for three years now. She works from 4 p.m. to 10 p.m. (for six hours in the evenings only) daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
This will be her fourth loan from Tujijnge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase grocery stock and for school fees and household expenses. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase beer stock. Her dream is to one day be able to open a shop for selling food.
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Jitahidi Msakuzi," which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loan.use: To increase beer stock.

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a resident of Nyamira town where she carries out her farming business producing maize, beans and vegetables which she sells on the local market. She is married with three children, two of whom are schooling.
Joyce has made a loan request for 26,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says the dairy business will earn her income and enable her to educate the remaining child. She adds that she wants to start a tailoring business in future.
Joyce says animal diseases and low market prices for the produce are the challenges in the farming business.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Claudine

texts.en:
Claudine is 28 years old and is single. Her business is well organized and she sells clothes such as adults' and children's clothes in the market. She has three years' experience. She works from 8am to 7pm every day except on Saturday and she currently employs one person to help her.
She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand her clothing shop by purchasing various clothes such as adults' and children's clothes for resale. With her profits, she will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loan.use: To expand her clothing shop.

loan.name: Agripina

texts.en:
Agripina is a farmer in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya and is married with four children aged between 14 and 9 years. She has been in farming for the last 15 years producing tea, beans, vegetables and milk. Her family fully relies on farming for their upkeep.
Agripina has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says she intends to expand her farm and have three dairy cows in five years and believes she will be able to improve her family's living standards.
Agripina laments that farm inputs like fertilizers have become very expensive.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Ruth has a business selling clothes, which she has run for one year. To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, she hopes to expand her business. Ruth is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loan.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is a 53-year-old married woman with 4 adult children. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for 18 years. Rosenie is able to provide food, clothes and other needs of her family through her income from farming.
Rosenie is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs. She hopes for her farm to be always productive.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides and other farm inputs

loan.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses is a hardworking, 34-year-old business man. He is married and blessed with an 8-year-old child who is going to school. For the past 7 years, Moses has been running a hotel so that he is able to provide for his family. He supplements income from this venture with earnings he gets from engaging in the transport business. In the next 5 years he wants to open up a well-furnished restaurant. His dream is to build rental houses. Moses is requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy maize, wheat flour and rice. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for teaching him business management skills.

loan.use: to buy maize, wheat flour and rice

loan.name: Zubeda

texts.en:
Zubeda is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 6 children. Three of her children are currently in school. Zubeda has a business of selling clothes, which she has had for over 10 years.
To help expand her business, Zubeda has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Zubeda hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Zubeda hopes to expand her business. Zubeda is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase clothes for resale

loan.name: Wesley

texts.en:
Wesley is a father of one and a farmer in Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. He has been in farming for five years with his produce of maize, tea, bananas and milk going to the local market.
Wesley has made a loan request of 26,167 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow and believes the additional dairy cow in his farm will enable him to improve his family's living standard. He aspires to own a vehicle and venture into the transport business as well as purchasing more land to expand his dairy farming.
Wesley sees hailstones and competition resulting from farmers' production of one type of crop as the greatest threats to farming in the area. He is glad Juhudi is helping farmers improve their living standards.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Charles

texts.en:
Born in 1965, Charles is a focused and hardworking businessman, married and blessed with four children who attend school. Since 2002, Charles has been repairing automobiles to earn a living, and within the next five years wants to have expanded his garage to serve more clientele. His dream is to venture into other business sectors via investment.

Charles is requesting a loan of 15000 Kenya shillings to buy tools such as spanners. Thanks to Faulu Kenya he is now able to save and access credit.

loan.use: to buy tools such as spanners.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loan.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses, 38 years old, is married to Esther. They have four children who are under ten years old.
Moses has a retail shop that he has been running for three years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. to enable him to buy eggs, sugar, cooking oil and soft drinks to add to his stock.
The anticipated profits made from this business will enable him to take care of his family well. He hopes to expand his business and to open up a wholesale shop.

loan.use: to buy eggs, sugar, cooking oil and soft drinks to add to his stock.

loan.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is 27 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is single and has one child, who is not currently in school. Morris has a health clinic, which he has run for two years. To help expand his business, Morris has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase medicines to sell to his patients. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Morris hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for himself. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further. Morris is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by increasing his earnings.

loan.use: to purchase medicine for resale.

loan.name: Nura

texts.en:
Nura is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. Nura has a poultry farm business that sells chickens, which she has run for one year. She owns rental houses as a second business.
To help expand her business, Nura has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Nura hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Nura is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loan.name: Stanley

texts.en: Stanley was born in 1981. He is a focused and hardworking businessman. He is single. Since the year 2000, he has been operating a boutique to make ends meet. Over the next five years, he wants to have penetrated and invested in other sectors of the economy. His dream is to be a real estate mogul. He is requesting a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy clothes, shoes and mattresses for resale. He is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for giving him access to credit facilities.

loan.use: to buy clothes, shoes and mattresses for resale.

loan.name: James

texts.en:
James is 36 and has been involved farming for the last 10 years in his hometown of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. He produces and sells tea to the Kenya Tea Development Authority. He also produces maize and milk and sells these products to the local market. James is married and has 3 children, all of school going age. James also works as a driver.
James has made a loan request for 41,867 KES, from Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the improved business will help him in improving his family's living standards and educating his children. He adds that he would like to build a permanent house for his family and hopes this will happen.
James says stiff competition, especially for dairy, during high seasons remains a challenge.

loan.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to open an outlet of a boutique in Mlolongo.

loan.name: Rauben

texts.en: Rauben is 40 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Rauben has a small retail shop, which sells sugar, which he has run for five years. He has a poultry farm as his second business. To help expand his business, Rauben has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities such as sugar for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Rauben hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further. Rauben is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped his prospects for the future by helping him reach his dreams.

loan.use: to purchase essential commodities, such as sugar, for resale.

loan.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is a hardworking 44-year-old businesswoman. She is married and blessed with a 14-year-old child, who attends school. For the last 16 years, in order to provide for her family, she has been making juice to sell. In the next five years, she wants to have grown and expanded her business so that she is able to realize her dream of building her own house and owning her own company. Ann is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy bottles and sugar flavors. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for educating her about proper financial management and enabling her to buy plots of land.

loan.use: to buy bottles and sugar flavors.

loan.name: Burombe Bakyara Kweterana Group

texts.en: Robert is a 49-year-old married father of six children aged between 14 and 24. He lives in Rukungiri and is self-employed. He says he was inspired by a friend to start up his business selling second-hand shoes in the town of Rukungiri. Robert earns 15,000 Ugandan Shillings profit per week from this business. He also sells bananas and other agricultural produce to supplement his income. Robert is hardworking and he has managed to sustain his business for 23 years. He has a dream of expanding his business in the future. He is requesting this Kiva loan to buy more second-hand shoes for resale.

loan.use: to buy more second-hand shoes for resale.

loan.name: Nateku

texts.en:
Nateku is 48 years old, married to Toyoto, and has been blessed with children.
Nateku is a livestock trader. She sells to butcher men and the Kenya Meat Commission. She has been doing this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES17,580 per month. She was introduced to KADET by an existing KADET customer.
Nateku is applying for her second loan of KES50,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more livestock, like two cows, ten goats and others. She will use the anticipated profits to establish a dairy farm.
She hopes to have a big dairy farm and to be supplying milk to the surrounding markets.

loan.use: to purchase more livestock.

loan.name: Christine's Group

texts.en: Christines group is comprised of two hardworking women. Christine is 16 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. Christine has a beauty salon business, which she has run for two years. To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase hair braids for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Christine hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Christine is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has aided her prospects for the future by helping her to pay her school fees from the earnings from her business.

loan.use: to purchase hair braids for resale.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has one child, who is not currently in school. Ruth has a poultry farm business that rears chickens, which she has run for one year. To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase chickens for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Ruth hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Ruth is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase chickens for resale.

loan.name: James

texts.en:
James is a farmer in his native town of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. His farm produces maize, bananas, sugarcane, tea and milk. He has been farming for the last 10 years. He lives with his family of 6 children, 2 of whom are still schooling.
James has made a loan request of 36,633 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income generated from farming will be used to meet family needs, especially the education of his last 2 children who are still schooling. James aspires to buy a vehicle and venture into the transport business. James laments about the fluctuation of farm prices in the market as the major challenge in the farming business.

loan.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loan.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. Sylvia has a business selling clothes, which she has run for two years. To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase clothes for resale. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Sylvia is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase clothes for resale.

loan.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret, 44, is a hardworking, ambitious businesswoman who is a servant to the community. She is single and a proud mother to a 15-year-old school-going child. Since the year 2010, Margaret has been running a consultancy firm in psychology and HIV counseling. She supplements her income from this trade with the rent she collects from her rental houses. Previously, she was a salaried employee. Margaret is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a computer. She is grateful to Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, for making credit facilities easily accessible to her.

loan.use: to buy a computer.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase more stock like sugar, flour, tea leaves,cooking oil, etc.

loan.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 47 years old and is married with 4 children. The oldest child is 23 years old, while the youngest is 8 years old. Gilda's husband works as a farmer and an electrician.
Gilda runs a tailoring shop. She makes dresses and uniforms. She also provides general clothing alterations to the people in her community. Gilda also helps her husband work at their rice farm when she can. She also raises goats.
Gilda is requesting a loan to buy cloth, needles, threads, and seeds and fertilizers. She hopes to have a successful business in the future.

loan.use: to buy cloth, needles, threads, and seeds and fertilizers

loan.name: Aisse

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme marie. Elle est animatrice bnvole dans un programme de sant communautaire pour les enfants et les femmes en tat de grossesse. Elle exerce en mme temps une activit de commerce de produits cosmtiques, d'huile de palme, de tissus teints.Elle le mne avec une de ses trois filles qui a reu une formation de trois ans en teinture et art mnager.Elle est membre de l'IMCEC depuis son installation et a t lu prsidente du conseil d'administration de la caisse de sa localit.Elle a obtenu 4 prts de l'IMCEC qu'elle a rembours entirement. Elle sollicite un autre prt de 250 000F pour acheter 30litres d'huile de palme, 30litres de citron,60metres de tissus, 10 draps GM et des produits cosmtiques dont la vente lui permettra d'appuyer son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins de la famille mais aussi de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Son ambition est de crer une grand magasin de commerce de produits agricole et de tissus teints.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman. She is a volunteer group leader in a community health care program for children and pregnant women. At the same time, she has a business involving cosmetics, palm oil, and dyed cloth. She runs it with the help of one of her three daughters who received three years of training in the dying of cloth and home economics. She has been a member of the micro-finance institution IMCEC since it was set up, and she was elected president of the administrative board of its branch office in her town. She obtained four loans from IMCEC that she repaid completely. She is requesting another loan of 250,000 francs to buy 30 liters of palm oil, 30 liters of citron, 60 meters of cloth, 10 GM sheets, and some cosmetics. The sale of these goods enables her to support her husband to meet the needs of the family but also to meet her own needs. Her ambition is to establish a large store for farm produce and for dyed cloth.

loan.use: to buy 30 liters of palm oil, 30 liters of 'citron', 60 meters of cloth, 10 'GM' sheets, and some cosm

loan.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson is a focused and a hard-working 23-year-old businessman. He is married but has no children. To make ends meet for the last three years, he has been involved in welding and metal fabrication. He wants in the next five years to have his business grow and become stable so as he is able to realize his dream of being financially stable.
He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy metal sheets. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for their immense advice that has enabled his business to grow.

loan.use: to buy sheet metal.

loan.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 27 and has been in the farming business for 2 years in his hometown of Nyamira, South Rift, Kenya. His farm produces maize, milk and beans. He is married with one child, age 2 years old.
Eric has requested Juhudi Kilimo to advance him a loan of 26,167 KES in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says the income will help him improve his family living standards. His focus for the dairy business is to have a farm of 3 dairy cows in 5 years.
Eric says the greatest challenge in farming are pests affecting both animals and crops.

loan.use: to pay for purchase and insurance of a dairy cow

loan.name: Bonaventure

texts.en:
Bonaventure is 25 years old and is married with one child who is 2 years old. He has owned a small business selling shoes for the past 11 years. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 6am until 6pm every day, except Saturday.
He has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by purchasing various shoes for adults and children. With the profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loan.use: expand his shoe business

loan.name: Isaac Obare

texts.en:
Isaac is 26 years old, married and has two children aged three years old and two years old. He runs a small grocery store in a residential area in Nairobi. He has been in this business for three years now and says his major challenge is financial constraints.
Isaac is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to stock tomatoes, cabbages and eggs to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and also open a retail shop. He also hopes to take good care of his family and provide for all their needs. He describes himself as committed, determined and God-fearing.

loan.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbages and eggs.

loan.name: Felegona

texts.en:
Felegona is 45 years old, married to Jacob, and they have 6 children who are all above 10 years old.
Felegona has a grocery business that she has been running for the past 25 years. She is currently applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a friend who is also a KADET client. Felegona wants to use the money to buy watermelon, lemons, coconuts, mangoes and oranges to add to her stock.
She hopes to be able to build her own residential house in the near future.

loan.use: to buy watermelon, lemons, coconuts, mangoes to add to her stock

loan.name: Maisha Zakhiem Group

texts.en:
Ashura, who is in her mid 20's, is single. She has been running a soft drinks business for 8 months now. She works from 8 a.m to 7 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be her first loan from Tujujenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy more water, juice and sodas to sell. Her dream is to one day be able to sell new clothes from door-to-door and also to be able to buy land.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Misha Zakhiem", which has a total of 18 members, who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loan.use: to buy more water, juice and sodas to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a sewing machine and materials to add to her stock

loan.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 30 years old and married to Stella. They have 2 school-going children.
Charles has a retail shop that he has been running for 2 years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to add stock to his business. The anticipated profits will be used to cater to his family's needs. He hopes to be able to open up a wholesale shop in the future.

loan.use: to buy sugar, milk, tealeaves, cooking oil, etc. to add to his stock

loan.name: Sieng

texts.en: Mrs. Sieng is the mother of nine children, and heading such a large family is a significant responsibility. Two of her children work as factory workers in Phnom Penh. Five are married and have moved away from home. Four are single. Presently, Mrs.Sieng is a farmer and her husband works as a palm climber, harvesting coconuts. He earns $3 per day. Mrs.Sieng and her husband wish to borrow $500 in order to repair their old and run down house.

loan.use: to repair their old and run down house.

loan.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 30 years old and lives in Bardnersville. She is married and has 2 children, 7 and 13 years old. They all live with her at home and attend school. Her husband is a driver.
For the past 5 years, Julia has been selling oil, rice and pepper on a table in the local market. She started her business by selling at the table market. From this business she has been able to send her children to school, feed the family, provide for their clothing, and pay her house rent. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil and flour for her business. Her plan is to buy land and send her children to quality schools.

loan.use: to purchase rice, oil and flour for her business

loan.name: Tursunoy

texts.en: Tursunoy lives in Dushanbe. She is 48 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband is a baker. Tursunoy has a higher education in economics. Tursunoy is taking out the loan to help her daughter expand her business. Her eldest daughter, Dilnoza, works sewing and embroidering traditional dresses. She has been doing this work for three years. She is taking out the loan to buy fabric, beads, and colored thread to sew embroidered dresses for sale.

loan.use: to buy fabric, beads, and colored thread

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase rice, oil and building materials for her business

loan.name: Rabia's Group

texts.en:
Rabia is involved in the teaching profession. She has studied till intermediate level and teaches different subjects to her students. She is a very good teacher and her students like her way of teaching very much.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the expansion of her brothers embroidery business. He operates his business from his home and is an expert in his field. Due to his good quality work, he receives regular orders every month.
With the loan, he will buy embroidery materias in bulk quantity which will help him fill his orders on time and increase his profits. He has been doing this business for the past five years and Rabia is confident that after the loan investment, her brother will be able to meet requirements of his customers and increase his profits.

loan.use: To buy embroidery material for embroidery business.

loan.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and brother).
Jalia has a business selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works six days out of every week. Jalia sells her products at the market, retail. She has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through poultry farming.
The main business challenges for Jalia include seasonality and the ever-increasing price of used clothes. Her goal for her business is to sell wholesale only. Jalia lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

loan.name: Nasimi

texts.ru: Nasimi jenat i imeyet 2 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Nasimi 34 qoda. On uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya prodajey pishevix produktov. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego otca. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit produkti dlya pereprodaji i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Nasimi is married and has two children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his beloved family. Nasimi is 34 years old. He has been working as a grocer for seven years. He started this business with his father. Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs for resale and to expand his business.

loan.use: to buy foodstuffs for resale

loan.name: Papa

texts.en:
Papa is 40 years old and lives in Bardnersville. He is married and has 2 children, ages 16 and 18. They all live at home. His wife has been working as a social worker.
For the past 7 years, Papa has been selling shoes and used clothes. He is requesting a loan to purchase shoes and used clothes for his business. His plans are to send his children to school and build his house.

loan.use: to purchase shoes and used clothes for his business

loan.name: Asmaa

texts.en:
Asmaa is a 21-year-old single lady who started at a young age making different types of mattresses and pillows, mostly the ones used for Arabian seating arrangements.
Basically what Asmaa does is bring in different sizes of sponge that are used as stuffing material for the mattresses. She also sews covers for the mattresses. Despite her young age, Asmaa is well-known in her area in Al Mafraq.
Now Asmaa has applied for a loan to buy more sponge and other materials for the business.

loan.use: To buy more sponges and other materials for her business.

loan.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 36 years old and lives in the community of Airport in Liberia. She is married and has two children (3 months and 11 years old), one of whom is in school. For the past seven years she has been selling plantains, eddoes, and potatoes. One of her business challenges is that she has more customers than she has inventory. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains, eddoes, and potatoes for her business. Her future plans include building a house and sending her children to school.

loan.use: to purchase plantain, eddoes, potatoes for her business

loan.name: Robina's Group

texts.en:
Robina is 33 years old, married and has two sons. Both of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Her husband is a government employee and Robina operates a grocery store adjacent to her home where she sells grocery such as spices, sugar, cooking oil, etc. at very reasonable prices. She started this business to help her husband financially as his income is not enough to fulfill the needs of his family.
Robina is also a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities and also takes care of her children very well. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her grocery business that will allow her to fill the needs of her customers and increase her profits.
She has been operating her business for the past two years and is confident that an investment will be profitable for her and help her establish her business. She is a new loan applicant and very hopeful about her business future.

loan.use: To buy groceries for her grocery store business.

loan.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan is a 21-year-old single lady, who is also a university student majoring nursery in her last year. Rawan has two hobbies; one is photography and the other is arranging decorative flowers.
Rawan decided to use one of her hobbies and turn it into a small business at home, with the help of her mother; she has a successful start making beautiful decoration plants.
Now Rawan is applying for a loan to buy more materials used in her business, hoping that she will be able to use natural flowers in the future and open her own flower store.

loan.use: To buy more materials used in making decoration items.

loan.name: Zaina

texts.en:
Zaina lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. Zaina has a retail shop. She has been in this business for many years, and she works six days out of every week.
Zaina sells her products at the market, retail. She has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil The main business challenges for Zaina include transportation and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and also to own a delivery van.
Zaina lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loan.name: Etidal

texts.en:
Etidal is a 40-year-old hard-working woman. Three years ago, she started up a small workshop to make handmade master pieces and crafts using whatever material she has; wood, clay, etc.
Because of her talent she made her business grow and turned it into a successful one. Now Etidal has applied for a loan to buy a kiln to help her improve the quality of the crafts she makes.

loan.use: To buy a kiln for the crafts she makes.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase oil, rice, pepper and salt for her business.

loan.name: Manzurakhon

texts.en: Manzurakhon lives in Dushanbe. She is 39 years old, divorced, and has three children. She lives with her parents. Manzurahon has a secondary education. She has been sewing for more than fifteen years. Basically she sews traditional dresses. She is taking out a loan to buy fabric.

loan.use: to buy fabric.

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a hard-working 52-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with four children. Since the year 2004 he has been offering tailoring services so as to meet the needs of his family. He makes extra money by supplying stationery. He wants in the next five years to have grown and expanded his business so that he can peacefully retire to farming.
He is requesting 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy materials for tailoring and liquid soap. He is grateful to Faulu Kenya for training him on how to budget.

loan.use: to buy sewing materials and liquid soap.

loan.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz belongs to a poor family and has six children. It is very difficult for her husband to fulfill the needs of his family with the limited income which he earns from his auto rickshaw driving business.
Shahnaz is very supportive lady by nature. She supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighborhood clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to change the body of his auto rickshaw as it has become rough and never makes a good impression on the passengers.
Shahnaz is a very positive-minded person and confident that after changing his rickshaw body, her husband will not only be able to save his business asset but also be able to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his profits.
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loan.use: To change the body of an auto-rickshaw.

loan.name: Mehdi

texts.ru: Mehdi yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Yemu 22 qoda. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Mehdi uje 2 qoda kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva molochnogo produkta dlya prodaji.
texts.en:
Mehdi is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region. He is 22 years old. He is single and has no children.
Mehdi has been a herdsman and cattle breeder for two years. Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy cows to increase his milk production.

loan.use: to buy cows

loan.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 41 years old; she is single and blessed with one child.
Caroline owns a boutique. She has been doing this business for the last four years and gets an income of KES 4,000 per month.
She was introduced to KADET by a KADET staff member. She is applying for her second loan for KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the whole amount to purchase more clothes for sale. She will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her son.
She hopes to become a prominent business woman.

loan.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loan.name: Huda

texts.en:
Huda is a 35-year-old married woman, who has four children to raise, together with her husband. To help her husband in supporting the family, Huda started a small retail business five years ago selling clothes and towels as shown in the picture.
Now Huda has applied for a loan to make a display area for the products she is selling, hoping that she will have her own clothes store in the future.

loan.use: To make a display area for the clothes she sells.

loan.name: David

texts.en:
David is 26 years old and he hawks polythene bags. He has been running this business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of about KES 20,000.
He has been loaned KES 40,000 by KADET Ltd. This is his third loan from KADET. He intends to use the loan to open a shop where he can be selling from. He plans to use the anticipated profit from his business to open up a general shop.
In the future, he hopes to have a wholesale business.

loan.use: to open a shop where he can be selling from

loan.name: Felecia

texts.en: Felecia is 30 years old ,and lives in airport community. She is married and has children between the ages of 1 to 11 years old. They are all in school. For the past ten years she been selling frozen food. Some of the problem she is facing is more customers and less goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase frozen food (chicken, meat, pig fool ) for the business. Her plan is to build her house and send her children to school.

loan.use: to purchase frozen food (chicken, meat, pig fool ) for the business,

loan.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is an embroidery and clothes-sewing expert and receives regular orders every month. This income helps her pay her utility bills and pay the school fee of her three children who are studying in different classes. Nusrat is also a very good housewife who manages her household responsibilities with her work very well.
Her husband operates a video games shop in the market. He offers different arcade games to the children of his community who like his games very much.
Nusrat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her clothes-sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine that will help her complete the orders in a shorter period of time and increase her profits. She has been operating her business for the past five years and is confident that her business will improve a lot with a new sewing machine.

loan.use: To buy a sewing machine for her sewing business.

loan.name: Seelwa

texts.en:
Seelwa is a 53-year-old woman, who has two sons and two daughters. Seelwa was born in Lebanon and now she is living with her family in Karak, a city in South Jordan.
Using her connection in Lebanon, Seelwa started importing cosmetics and cleaning products that are not available in Jordan. Since these products are new on the market, Seelwa faced a few difficulties in the beginning, three years ago, but successfully overcame them because of the quality of the products.
Now Seelwa is applying for a loan to increase the quantity that she brings in from Lebanon so she can expand her business in the near future.

loan.use: To increase the quantity of the cosmetics products that she imports.

loan.name: Mike

texts.en:
Mike is 32 years old and lives in Ololmasani in Kilgoris area and is married to Janet. They have three children ages six, four and two years old.
Mike has a retail shop that he has been running for the past two years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy a new stock of soft drinks, milk, bread and eggs for sale. Mike is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.
He hopes to expand his business which will help him earn more income and help him provide for his family.

loan.use: To buy soft drinks, milk, bread, eggs, etc. to add to his stock.

loan.name: Ruqaya

texts.en: Ruqaya is a 49-year-old widowed woman who has three sons and two daughters. When she was young, Ruqaya used to embroider pillows and table covers as a hobby. Later, she worked on improving her skills by challenging herself to do other types of embroidery such as wall hangings and traditional dresses. When people who visited her home saw the embroidery she did for her house they started to make special orders. As a result, Ruqaya turned her hobby into her own small business, which she can depend on for an income to support her and her family, especially after her husband passed away. Now Ruqaya has applied for a loan to buy more material and tools that will help speed up her production so that she can serve her customers on time. Because Ruqaya is a conservative person, her daughter Sabha is photographed instead of her.

loan.use: to buy more material and tools for her sewing business.

loan.name: Lira

texts.en:
Lira, 31, is married and lives in the village of Tash-Aryk in the Talas district. Lyra is raising five daughters, two of whom are college students, in her close-knit family. Her husband, Sultanmurat, is the mainstay in her life. In 2000, the couple decided to start a business breeding cattle, which was begun by buying a cow for 5,000 som (KGS). Through hard work and dedication, her farm now has ten head of sheep and one horse. Also, the family farms 1.5 hectares of irrigated land, where they have planted grasses and beans. In order to further development her business, Lira is asking for a loan in the amount of 50,000 Som (KGS) to increase the number of her livestock.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase coal bags and charcoal for her business,

loan.name: Fargana

texts.ru: Fargana ne zamujem i ne imeyet detey. Ona yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoimi roditelyami. Fargane 36 let. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya razvitiya svoyego biznessa. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey teti. Uje 5 let kak Fargana zanimayetsya skotovodstvom i razvodit korov.
texts.en:
Fargana is single and has no children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). She is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with her parents. Fargana is 36 years old.
Now she needs 2000 AZN to buy cattle to expand her business. She started this business with her aunts. Fargana has been working as a herdsman and cattle breeder for five years.

loan.use: to buy cows

loan.name: Maksadjon

texts.en: Maksadjon lives in Dushanbe. He is 20 years old. He is married. He has a secondary education. Maksadjon has worked in sales for two years. He has a general store. He is taking out a loan to buy food, household goods, SIM cards and chargers for mobile phones.

loan.use: to buy food, household goods, SIM cards and chargers for mobile phones.

loan.name: Nabeela

texts.en: Nabeela is a 39-year-old mother who has a small retail business selling clothes at home in Al Zarqa. She has been engaged in this business for two years and is able to support her husband who has a store selling fruits and vegetables. Now Nabeela want to have her own store to be able to show the products that she sells in a more professional way, and to add other types of clothes to sell. It is for this reason that she has applied for this loan.

loan.use: to have her own clothing store.

loan.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Zarina is 47 years old and has six children. Unfortunately, none of them was able to complete their education due to financial constraints. Two of her children have a business making "Pranday" (an ornament used to tie back the hair) while one works in a medical store for a low income.
Zarina's husband has a shoe-making business. He makes contracts from different shoe-selling stores in cities and fills their orders to earn profits. Zarina also supports her husband financially by making "Pranday". She operates this business with her two daughters. She sells these "Pranday" to different cosmetics shops.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who has a large order to fill. With the loan, he will buy leather, nails and shoe polish in bulk to be able to complete the orders on time and earn more profit.
He has been operating his business for the past 15 years and Zarina hopes that an investment will put her husbands business into a well-established position.

loan.use: To buy leather, nails and shoe-polish for her husband's shoe-making business.

loan.name: Khady

texts.fr: Lemprunteuse est mere de trois enfants. Pour participer lentretien de sa famille, elle se lance dans un commerce de produits cosmtiques sur un premier financement de son mari. Au dbut, elle placait ses produits au niveau des clients qui payaient au bout de deux mois. Avec lappui de lIMCEC, elle a reussi ouvrir une cantine au march de la gare. Aujourdhui, son commerce lui permet damliorer non seulement lalimentation et la sant mais aussi et surtout de subvenir ses besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Elle sollicite un prt de 100000F pour renforcer son commerce en achetant notamment 10 caisses de lait de beaut, 05 cartons de parfum et des produits divers. Son ambition est de devenir grossiste pour approvisionner les boutiques de quartier de la ville.
texts.en:
This borrower is a mother of three children. To help care for her family, she got started in the commerce of cosmetics with initial financing from her husband. At first, she took orders from her customers, who paid at the end of two months. With IMCEC support, she has managed to open a stall at the bus station's market. Today, her business enables her to improve not only the nourishment and health care of her children but also to support herself and them in particular.
She is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to bolster her business by buying specifically 10 cases of lotion, 5 boxes of perfumes, and a variety of products. Her ambition is to become a wholesaler to supply the district shops in the city.

loan.use: to buy 10 cases of lotion, 5 boxes of perfume, and various other products

loan.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 34 years old and makes "Pranday" (an ornament used to tie-back the hair) to share the financial burden with her family. "Pranda" is a very famous local product among women.
Her husband is a cobbler and makes shoes, taking orders from different shoe shops in the city. He is very skillful in his work and receives a good number of orders every month.
Nasreen has three sons and three daughters. Only three of them are presently able to get an education due to financial constraints but Nasreen is very hopeful that with the improvement of her husbands business she will be able to enroll her remaining children in school.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husbands shoe-making business. With the loan, he will purchase leather, nails and shoe polish to make larger quantity of shoes and increase his profits.
He has been operating his business for the past 12 years and Nasreen is confident that an investment will help him improve his business further.

loan.use: To buy nails, leather and shoe polish her husband's for shoe making business.

loan.name: Shadaan

texts.en:
Shadaan stays at home and takes care of her household responsibilities. She is very active still at the age of 52 and performs her household duties very well. She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are illiterate and couldnt get an education due to financial constraints.
Shadaan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sons shoe making business. This is her family business and all of her children are involved in this business. With the loan, her son will buy shoe making materials such as leather, shoe laces, glue and shoe polish, etc. in larger quantity that will allow him to fill the customers' orders on time and earn better profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past 15 years.
Shadaan hopes that an investment will be a profitable one for her son.

loan.use: To buy shoe-making material for her son's shoe-making business.

loan.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Lemprunteur est un homme mari et pere de trois enfants dont les deux frquentent lcole primaire. Il est soudeur mtallique et rcupre du fer et de laluminium pour en faire des fourneaux, des marmites et des calebasses.Il utilise ses revenus dans la prise en charge des besoins alimentaires, vestimentaires et sanitaires de sa famille.Il a dmar cette activit en 2003 avec un montant de 150000F pour la location dun magasin au march central et lachat doutils de travail.Il est socitaire de lIMCEC et sollicite un prt de 400000F pour augmenter sa production en confectionnant 20 marmites, 100fourneaux,80 fourneaux PM,50 calebasses.Aujourdhui, son ambition est de raliser lextension de son atelier en le scindant en deux parties, lune pour la confection et lautre pour lexposition et la vente. Il envisage aussi dacqurir du matriel plus moderne et plus performant.
texts.en:
This borrower is a married man and the father of three children, of whom two attend primary school. He is a welder, and he acquires iron and aluminum for making stoves, cooking pots, and calabashes. He uses his income to feed, clothes, and care for the health of his family. He started this business in 2003 with the sum of 150,000 francs for leasing a store at the central market and for buying work tools.
He is an associate of IMCEC and is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to increase his production by making 20 cooking pots, 100 stoves, 80 'PM' stoves, and 50 calabashes.
Today, his ambition is to complete an extension of his workshop by dividing it: one part for manufacturing and the other part for displays and sales. He also envisions acquiring more modern and effective tools and equipment.

loan.use: to buy 20 cooking pots, 100 stoves, 80 PM stoves, and calabashes

loan.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda lives in Dushanbe. She is 51 years old. She is divorced and has four children. She has a vocational education as a cook. Mavjuda worked in her profession for four years. Currently, she rents a shop where she makes savory pies and fried meat pies and sells them. She has been doing this work for five years. She is taking out a loan to buy flour, butter, meat, onions and to pay her rent.

loan.use: to buy flour, butter, meat, onions and to pay her rent.

loan.name: Nargiza

texts.en:
Nargiza was born in the village of Kara-Tube (in the Chuy region of Kyrgyzstan). She is married and has two sons and a daughter. Nargiza was born into a simple farmer's family.
She was the youngest daughter and has always helped her mother care for the house and her father care for cattle, as her older sister and brothers grew up and moved out. After she finished school, her parents married Nargiza to a guy the same village, and a year later she had a daughter. In the beginning, she and her husband lived with her husband's parents. He worked at a local farm, helping his father care for the cattle and the land on which the whole family grew vegetables and grains.
In 2007, they had a son, and in that same year, they sold all of their livestock, and her husband bought Nargiza a small house in his native village. Their parents gave the young family a milk cow and horse, which became the first contribution to their own business. Over time, the little farm grew and so did the family - last year Nargiza bore another son.
Now Nargiza's farm has four milk cows (allowing the family to have a monthly income of about 15,000 som from the sale of milk), four calves and four horses. To increase the number of livestock they have and area of the barn, Nargiza applied for a loan from Bai-Tushum and Partners for 80,000 Som (KGS). Nargiza plans to further develop her successful business which will help realize her dream: to buy an SUV.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Saliou

texts.fr: Lemprunteur est un jeune enseignant g de 39 ans. Il est lain dune famille de six enfants dont une fille qui vient davoir son Baccalaurat. Aucun membre de cette famille nexerce un emploi stable. Il est mari et pre dune petite fille. Durant les trois mois de vacances scolaires, Il est oblig de pratiquer lembouche bovine et lagriculture pour augmenter ses revenus afin de faire face aux nombreuses charges familiales .Ainsi, il achte des boucs quil engraisse sur une priode de quatre mois avant de les revendre sur les marchs hebdomadaires de ma zone.Le bouc qui lui revient 25000F est revendu 50000F soit 50% de bnfices par tte.Pour largir son march, il sollicite un prt de 484000F pour acheter 15 boucs et de laliment de btail.Son vux le plus cher est darriver un jour mettre sur pied une ferme d'levage de bovins.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young teacher, aged 39. He is the oldest of a family of six children, including a daughter who just got her high school diploma. No one in his family has a steady job. The borrower is married and the father of a young daughter. During the three months of vacation in the academic year, he has to work at fattening cattle and agriculture in order to increase his revenues, so as to cope with many family expenses.
Thus, he buys goats that he fattens over a period of four months. And then he sells them at the weekly markets in the area. A goat costing him 25,000 francs is resold for 50,000 francs, the profit amounting to 50% a head.
To expand his market, he is requesting a loan of 484,000 francs to buy 15 goats and some animal feed. His greatest wish is to set up a livestock farm one day.

loan.use: to buy 15 goats and some animal feed

loan.name: Masline Moraa

texts.en:
Masline is married and they have three children aged between sixteen years old and ten years old. She sells water in a residential area in Nairobi. She has been in this business for four years now and says her major challenge is financial constraints.
She is using her loan of Kes 20,000 to purchase a water tank to supply water to more people. She hopes to grow her business and in future diversify to a retail shop business. She describes herself as ambitious and committed.

loan.use: to buy a water tank.

loan.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is 27 years old and involved in the business of making "Pranday" (an ornament used to tie back the hair). It is a very famous product among women.
Her husband is a cobbler and makes shoes. He sells shoes to different factories and shoe shops. He has a good number of business contacts and receives regular orders every month.
Robina is the mother of two children. Both of them are very young and are not of school-going age yet.
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further growth of her husbands shoe-making business. With the loan, he will be able to make a larger quantity of shoes due to the availability of shoe-making materials. Robina will also invest some of the loan in her "Pranday"-making business in hope of getting better profits.
Her husband has been operating his business for the past six years and Robina has a lot of confidence in him. She hopes that taking a loan will be a profitable experience for her.
She is a new loan applicant with Asasah.

loan.use: To buy shoe-making material and material for making "Paranda" (an ornament used to tie back the hair).

loan.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Lemprunteur est un aviculteur qui dispose dun magasin de vente de poussins, dufs et daliment au bord de la la route nationale N1, face au march local et la gare. Cette position en pleine centre ville lui vaut bonne visibilit et de nombreux clients.En plus, il gre un levage de poulets de chair la sortie de la ville.Ces activits lui rapportent des revenus assez consistants qui lui permettent de nourrir ses 02 pouses et ses 03 enfants en plus de ses frres et surs qui sont sa charge.Lemprunteur a capitalis une exprience de 14 ans aprs avoir t form en aviculture par une ONG locale.Il est socitaire de lIMCEC qui lui a octroy un premier prt rembours entirement avant terme.Il sollicite un deuxime prt de 200 000F afin dacheter 150 plateaux dufs et 110 poussins. Il envisage dans le futur de transformer son poulailler en une grande entreprise avicole qui pourra crer des emplois pour les jeunes et les femmes.
texts.en:
This borrower is a poultry farmer who has an outlet store selling chicks, eggs, and feed along the N1, the national road, and opposite the local market and the bus station. This location in the middle of town is very valuable for its visibility and the number of customers. In addition, he runs a farm for raising broiler chickens at the city's exit. These businesses bring in revenues substantial enough to allow him to feed his two wives and his three children in addition to his brothers and sisters, who are in his care. This borrower has capitalized on fourteen years of experience following his training in poultry farming by a local NGO.
He is an associate of the micro-finance institution IMCEC, which granted him an initial loan, which was completely repaid early. He is requesting a second loan of 200,000 francs to buy 150 trays of eggs and 110 chicks.
For the future, he envisions transforming his chicken coop into a major poultry enterprise that will be able to create jobs for young people and for women.

loan.use: to buy 150 trays of eggs and 110 chicks

loan.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida shares the financial burden with her husband by operating a "Pranday" (an ornament used to tie back the hair) making and selling business. She gets orders from different cosmetics shops in the market and fills their orders to earn profits for her family.
Her husband is a shoe-maker by trade. He makes very good quality shoes for his customers. He receives orders from different shoe stores in the city and fills their demand on time at a profit.
Zubaida is the mother of six children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husbands business. He has a large order to fill and Zubaida hopes that the loan will help him purchase shoe making materials in bulk to be able to fill the order.
He is very experienced in his business and has been doing it for the past 20 years. Zubaida is confident about her husbands improved financial business condition after the investment.

loan.use: To buy shoe-making materials for her husband's shoe-making business.

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married and has five children, age 21 to 10 years old. She lives in her own residential house in Karuguuza, Uganda.
For 14 years, Christine has had a bar and restaurant business, and from this business she has been able to build a commercial house.
She faces a challenge in the high rate of inflation.
She hopes to modify her business into a hotel. Christine intends to use the loan to buy crates of beer and food for sale.

loan.use: To buy beer and food to resell.

loan.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes, a 36-year-old mother of four children and wife to Kasaine, has been running a food kiosk for the last six years. Having learned about KADET through marketing done by the KADET staff, she is now requesting her fifth loan with which to buy more goods to sell. Agnes plans to reinvest the anticipated additional profit from this loan back into her business, and dreams of becoming a great businesswoman.

loan.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy clothes to resell.

loan.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a Ugandan male, age 27. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is the father of one child, age 3 years.
A retailer of two years, he acquired his start-up capital from farming Irish potatoes and maize.
He needs a loan to purchase sugar, salt, rice, mattresses and iron sheets to resell.
He dreams of acquiring more land and becoming a wholesaler.

loan.use: To purchase sugar, salt, rice, mattresses and iron sheets to sell.

loan.name: Raufjon

texts.en: Raufjon lives in Khujand. He is 21 years old. He is single. He has a secondary education. Raufjon has been working in animal husbandry for more than six years. He fattens and sells cattle. He is taking out a loan to purchase cattle.

loan.use: to purchase cattle.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to expand her business and purchase more stock.

loan.name: Igor

texts.fr:
Homme clibataire age de 37 ans, et pre de deux enfants dont l'age varie entre 3 et 9ans.Il commence avec la vente des bijoux en pacotilles en 2007 . Il sapprovisionne Kinshasa en bijoux pacotilles quil revend au march des prix favorable. Ses ventes par jour varient de 15.000F 30.000F. Avec le prt, il va acheter : les ensembles colliers, boucles doreilles, bracelets, bagues, vernis ongle, les gourmettes, des brillants lvres.
Son but est d'elargir son activite et d'etre un entrepreneur dans l'avenir.
texts.en:
This man is 37 years old, unmarried, and has two children aged 3 and 9. In 2007, he began selling costume jewelry.
He gets his supplies of costume jewelry in Kinshasa and re-sells them at the market at favourable prices. His daily sales vary from 15,000 F to 30,000 F. With this loan, he is going to buy sets of necklaces, earrings, bracelets, rings, nail polish, chain bracelets, and lip gloss.
His goal is to expand his business and become an entrepreneur in the future.

loan.use: To buy necklaces, earrings, bracelets, rings, and lip gloss.

loan.name: Neker

texts.en:
Neker is 37 years old and lives in the airport community. She is not literate. She is married and has four children between 11 and 16 years old. They are in school.
For the past 25 years she been selling soft drinks, beer and cold water. One of the problems she faces is a shortage of goods.
She is requesting a loan to purchase soft drinks, beer and cold water for her business. Her plan is to build a community clinic, keep her children in school and build a house.

loan.use: to purchase soft drinks, beer and cold water for her business,

loan.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 42 years old and married. He has three children.
He has been a mixed farmer for the last ten years. He was introduced to KADET by a registered client.
This is his third loan, with which he has planned to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals. He intends to use the return from the loan to plow back into farming and part to repay the loan.
His dreams are to become a famous farmer in the area and to educate his children to higher levels of education.

loan.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers, seeds and chemicals.

loan.name: Asghari's Group

texts.en:
Asghari is a 56-year-old widow. Her children are young and do different jobs. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son who is involved in an herbal medicine business. He not only sells herbal medicines but also makes medicines for his patients. He has been doing this business for the past nine years and has a good reputation among his patients. With the loan, he will buy herbs to be able to make medicines for his patients.
Two other sons are also herbal medicines experts and one has a shoe-making business. Her other three children stay at home and do not do anything. Asghari remains at home and does her household responsibilities. She is still very active and performs her tasks very well.
She is very confident that her son will be able to do well after the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy better living conditions.

loan.use: To buy herbs for her son's herbal medicines business.

loan.name: Rita

texts.en:
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen.
Rita is 22 years old. She is married and has one child, age 4.
In 2007, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.
She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to increase the inventory of her store.
In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

loan.use: to buy grocery goods. to resell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy goats for resale.

loan.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is asking for a loan to pay for land preparation and to purchase seeds to make his crop more productive. He has been a farmer for 10 years now. He is married with children.
Last harvest, Danilo earned P 18,000 net income in his production. He did not sell all of his yield so he stocked some sacks of rice for their food consumption.
In the future, Danilo hopes to boost his profits in order to give complete education to his two children so they can live a brighter future someday.

loan.use: to pay for land preparation and to purchase seeds to make his crop more productive.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer and to hire temporary field workers.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase farm supplies such as seeds and fertilizer.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase beverages and general merchandise such as sugar for resale.

loan.name: Rekha

texts.en:
Rekha is 31 years old . She is married and has two children aged 12 and 4. In 2004, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent one to expand the inventory of her store.
In the future, Rekha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.
Note: In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called "pasal", are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical "pasal" might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loan.use: to buy grocery goods for her store.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase another motorcycle.

loan.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina lives in Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and mother).
Regina has a retail shop. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works six days out of every week. Regina sells her products in her shop, retail. Regina has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil. She also generates additional income through her pay phone and selling milk.
The main business challenges for Regina include ever increasing prices of commodities and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale shop and to build rental rooms. Regina lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loan.use: To buy more bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil.

loan.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is 30 years old and a single mother of one child. Joselyne lives in a family house in Fort Portal, Uganda. For five years, Joselyne has been operating a poultry project. Her dream is to expand her poultry business and some day build her own home. Joselyne's main challenge is the high cost of feed. Joselyne would like to own at least 2,000 birds; she currently has 100. Joselyne is requesting this loan to buy chicken feed.

loan.use: to buy chicken feed.

loan.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza lives in Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (sister and brother).
Specioza has a business of poultry farming. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works 6 days out of every week. Specioza sells her products from home, by means of retail. Specioza has requested for a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings, from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed. She also generates additional income through a hardware business.
The main business challenge(s) for Specioza include poultry diseases and the transportation of chicken feed. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to sell by wholesale only. Specioza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food for the family.

loan.use: to buy more bags of chicken feed.

loan.name: Prudence Cynthia

texts.fr:
Marie, mre dun enfant g de 02 ans et ayant une personne sa charge. Depuis 7ans, elle sapprovisionne Kinshasa en bijoux pacotilles quelle revend au march sur un talage. Elle maitrise la qualit et les modles actuels pour satisfaire la demande de ses clientes, elle vend par jour 50.000F 70.000F.
Avec le prt, elle va acheter : les parures pour les crmonies, les ensembles colliers, boucles doreilles, bracelets, bagues, vernis ongle, peigne cheveux, des barrettes cheveux. Etant deja a son deuxieme cycle, elle a rembourser son pret son difficultes et a fait des epargnes considerables pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif , vendre beaucoup afin d'elargir son activite et douvrir une boutique.
texts.en:
This woman is a married mother of one child aged 2, and has one person in her care. For seven years, she has been getting supplies of costume jewelry in Kinshasa, which she re-sells at the market at a display stand. She has mastered her knowledge of the various qualities and current models in order to satisfy her customers' requests. She makes between 50,000 F and 70,000 F worth of sales each day.
With this loan, she is going to buy ceremonial finery, sets of necklaces, earrings, bracelets, rings, nail polish, decorative combs, and barrettes.
Being on her second loan cycle, she repaid her previous loan without difficulty and made considerable savings in order to achieve her objective, which was to sell a large quantity of items so as to expand her business and open a shop.

loan.use: To buy necklaces, earrings, bracelets, rings, and nail polish.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to rehabilitate her banana plantation.

loan.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other has graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past ten years, Beatrice has operated a poultry business, selling from home to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her potential customers are restaurant operators and passers-by. Beatrice dreams of becoming self-reliant in the future. With this 60,000 KES loan, Beatrice wants to renovate her chicken house and purchase more chicks. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to renovate her chicken house and purchase more chicks.

loan.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 32 years-old. She is married and has 2 children, aged 14 and 7. In 2000, she established her tailoring business. Working 6 days a week and 8 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring business.
In the future, Rita plans to uplift the economic conditons of her family. She thanks you for your support.
In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional material (fabric) or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loan.use: to buy raw materials for tailoring business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy a new motorcycle.

loan.name: Konah

texts.en: Konah is 31 years old and lives in Airport community. She is married and has two children, aged one and nine, who live at home and are in school. She started her business by selling charcoal; today she sells from a table in the local market. One thing she likes about her business is that it gives her more profit and fast money. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice and spices for her business. She hopes to build a house and buy a car in the future.

loan.use: to purchase oil, rice and spices for her business.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy bulk rice, oil and supplies.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 48 year-old married man with ten children. He owns a house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Joseph is a builder and also deals in quarrying stones. The major challenge is during the rainy season when the roads to the quarry are impassable. His desire is to solely own the quarry site.
Joseph needs the loan to hire people to quarry stones. His dream is to construct rental houses so as to financially sustain his family.

loan.use: To hire more people to quarry stones.

loan.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, Roda has operated a clothes sales business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. Roda dreams of owning her own business premises in the future. With this 50,000 KES loan, Roda wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Kiva partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loan.name: Pedro William

texts.es: Pedro, vive con su esposa y tres hijos, en su familia solamente l trabaja vendiendo ropa y medicina, este negocio lo aprendi cuando era empleado de un comercial y luego se decidi a instalar el negocio, hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades y tiene la esperanza de continuar creciendo. l solicita un prstamo para la compra de ropa (blusas, faldas, camisas formales) tambin medicamentos como analgsicos, antibiticos, vitaminas, esta inversin le ayudara a mantener el negocio y ofrecer a los clientes una variedad de productos.
