Our friend has had a small tailoring shop in her house for several years and she has crafted clothing for ladies and children. She works by taking orders from individual clients who visit her house. She works every day from 8am, once her children have gone off to school. She finishes at 10pm and sometimes even later when she needs to fill an order. She says that she never takes on more than she can complete because she wants to keep some time for her children. She also doesn't like to disappoint her clients.
This new loan will be used to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials. She is a founding member of the communal bank and she appreciates it for the loans, which have been a great help.
Her dream is to have a larger shop equipped with more sewing machines and with hired workers.

loan.use: to purchase fabrics, threads, buttons, zippers, and other sewing materials.

loan.name: Beln

texts.es: A la vivienda de la seora Beln le est haciendo falta los acabados del interior y exterior y la losa de concreto a dos cuartos que esta construyendo. Solicita el prstamo para poder comprar el material que es cemento, pintura, cable de luz y arena, ya que no cuentan con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. Quien se encargara de realizar la mejor es su esposo el seor Santos Efrn en horario adicional a su trabajo, se dedica a la construccin. Doa Beln se encargara de pagar el crdito con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas de productos de belleza. Ya que Don Santos Efrn se encargar de los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos que tiene. Desean mejorar la calidad de vida y que sus tres pequeos hijos tengan su propio espacio en la casa.
texts.en:
Seora Beln's house is under construction. The interior and exterior need to be finished and two of the bedrooms need a concrete slab. She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, paint, wiring, and sand since she doesn't have the money to finish it. Her husband, Seor Santos Efrn, is a construction worker and is making the improvements to their house during his off hours. Doa Beln is responsible for paying off the loan with her income from her beauty products sales as Don Santos Efrn is responsible for the household expenses and their children's school expenses.
They want to improve their quality of life and give their three small children their own space in the house.

loan.use: finish the interior and exterior of her house as well as pay for concrete slabs for two of the bedrooms.

loan.name: Guadalupe Esmeralda

texts.es: Guadalupe es una mujer que radica en el municipio de Monterrey. La seora Lupita es una empresaria que cuenta con 31 aos de edad. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos, todos ellos estudiantes dos estn en la primaria y dos en la secundaria. Guadalupe vende ropa usada y calzado por catlogo. Tiene varios aos ya con este negocio y con el crdito busca aumentar su mercanca, tener un buen rendimiento para invertir en un mejor negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en: Guadalupe is a woman who lives in the town of Monterrey. Lupita is a business woman who is 31 years old. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. Two of them are in elementary school and two are in secondary school. Guadalupe sells used clothes and shoes via catalogue. She has had this business for several years and seeks to increase her merchandise with the loan. She wants to have good sales in order to improve her business and get her family ahead.

loan.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loan.name: Yarendy Lourdes

texts.es:
En el cantn Rocafuerte se renen cada quince das las socias del Banco Comunal La Unin Hace La Fuerza. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareos y que son reconocidos en todo el pas.
En este lugar vive la seora Yarendy, tiene 28 aos de edad y mantiene una relacin de unin libre, actualmente est en el sexto mes de embarazo de su primer hijo. El marido trabaja en Manta.
Nuestra amiga se dedica a la cra de pollos para lo cual tiene una pequea granja en sus casa. Adems de esto ella en sociedad con su pap se dedican a la compra y venta de tamarindo, ellos compran este delicioso fruto directo de los arboles, recogen el producto para luego pelarlo, cocinarlo y entregarlo a tiendas de la localidad o venderlo directamente a los clientes. En cuanto a los pollos los alimenta durante un tiempo adecuado y luego los entrega a comerciantes en Rocafuerte.
Este crdito es para comprar tamarindo y alimento para pollos. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los crditos.
Su sueo es tener un beb sano.
texts.en:
The members of the La Union Hace Fuerza meet every two weeks in the Rocafuerte canton. This place is known for its delicious sweets made by the locals. They are known throughout the country.
Here Yarendy lives. She is 28 years old and is in a common long marriage. She is six months pregnant with her first child. Her husband works in Manta.
Our friend raises chickens and has a small barn at her house. In addition she has a business with her father buying and selling tamarinds. They buy this delicious fruit directly from the trees, pick up the product and peel it, cook it and deliver it to stores in the area, or sell directly to customers. The chickens she feeds for a long enough time and then delivers to merchants in Rocafuerte.
This loan is to buy tamarind and feed for the chickens. This her second cycle with the community bank and she likes it because of the ease of taking out loans.
Her dream is to have a healthy baby.

loan.use: to buy tamarinds and feed for chickens.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy a little cart to sell tacos.

loan.name: Aljadis Esther

texts.es: Aljadis vive en la ciudad de Cartagena con su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 7 a 13 aos, ella inici su negocio cuando procedente de su pueblo lleg a Cartagena en bsqueda de trabajo y como no consigui, se dedic al comercio. Inicialmente con calzado entre sus ms cercanos vecinos y amigos, hasta que gradualmente creci y diversific sus productos agregando ropa, cosmticos y perfumes. Su meta es ensancharlo y aumentar su clientela, pero su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para atender la demanda creciente. Esta es la razn por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprar ropa, perfumes, calzado y cosmticos en general. Su desafo es tener un almacn con todo lo que sus clientes necesitan y ella con sus esfuerzos se direcciona para lograr superarlo, pues espera lograr construir una educacin de calidad para sus hijos con el fin de que puedan ser exitosos.
texts.en:
Aljadis lives in the city of Cartagena with her husband and three children whose ages range from 7 to 13. She started her business when she arrived in Cartagena from her town seeking work. Since she didnt find work, she decided to go into commerce. She started out selling footwear among her neighbors and friends until she gradually grew and diversified her merchandise adding clothes, cosmetics and perfumes. Her goal is to expand and increase her clientele but her working capital is insufficient to meet growing demand.
This is the reason behind her request for a Kiva loan that shell use to buy clothes, perfumes, footwear and cosmetics in general. Her challenge is to have a store stocked with everything her customers need. She intends to overcome it through hard work because she hopes to build a quality education for her children so that they will be able to be successful.

loan.use: to buy clothes, perfume, footwear and cosmetics in general.

loan.name: Quetzalcoatl X Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "QUETZALCOATL X", POR QUE ES EL NOMBRE DEL LUGAR DONDE VIVEN. EL GRUPO SE LOCALIZA EN EL ESTADO DE PUEBLA EN MXICO. ESTA FORMADO POR 12 PERSONAS Y ES LA PRIMERA VEZ QUE SOLICITAN UN PRESTAMO LA SEORA PATRICIA ES INTEGRANTE DEL GRUPO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ANTOJITOS TIPICOS MEXICANOS, (TOSTADAS, CHALUPAS, MEMELITAS, ELOTES PREPARADOS. ELLA TIENE 35 AOS, ES CASADA Y TIENE DOS HIJOS QUE ESTUDIAN LA PRIMARIA, ES ORIGINARIA DE SU COMUNIDAD Y REQUIERE SU PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN INSUMOS COMO ELOTES, TOSTADAS, CREMAS, MAYONESA Y VERDURA POR MAYOREO Y ASI INCREMENTAR SUS GANANCIAS. CON LAS GANANCIAS QUE OBTENGA LAS SEGUIRA INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO Y AS APOYAR A SU FAMILIA EN LOS GASTOS DE LA CASA PARA BRINDARLES UNA MEJOR CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en: This group is called "Quetzalcoatl X," because this is name of the place where they live. They are located in the state of Puebla, Mexico. The group has 12 members and this is the first time that they have requested a loan. Patricia is a member of the group . She has a business selling traditional Mexican snacks (tostadas, chalupas, memelitas (a corn dough tart), and grilled corn.) She is 36 years old, married, and has two children who are in elementary school. She is a native of her community, and needs a loan to invest in supplies such as corn, tostadas, cream, mayonnaise, and vegetables at wholesale. In this way she can increase her earnings. With the earnings she gets, she will continue to invest in her business and in this way support her family and the household expenses so that she can provide them with a better quality of life.

loan.use: to purchase supplies such as corn, tostadas, cream, mayonnaise and vegetables

loan.name: Victoria Del Carmen

texts.es: Victoria Del Carmen tiene 35 aos, su actividad es la venta de mercadera en general. Este negocio empez hace 4 aos con muy poco capital de trabajo, como una bsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos ya que adems ella imparte clases en colegio pblico. Ella empez vendiendo muy pocos cosmticos, despus fue que empez a invertir un poco ms y obtener este medio de vida. El crdito ser invertido en la compra de lpiz labial, estuches calzados, ropa en general, bolsos, sabanas y otros. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artculos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades econmicas a ella y a sus tres hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria Del Carmen, 35, sells general merchandise. She started the business four years ago with very little working capital as a way of finding an additional source of alternative income since she also teaches in a public school.
She started out selling a few cosmetics and later on started investing a bit more to build this way of life. She will use this loan to buy lipsticks, kits, footwear, clothing in general, purses, sheets and others. Her goal is to have a general store eventually located in the market that will provide her and her three children with economic means.

loan.use: to buy stock merchandise.

loan.name: Hortencia

texts.es: La seora Hortencia es madres soltera y tiene dos hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quienes este aos entran a estudiar la primaria y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar los uniformes (ropa y zapatos) y tiles que son libros, cuadernos, colores, hojas de papel, lpices y mochilas. Solicita su cooperacin para este prstamo ya que desea que sus hijos estudien y tenga la educacin necesaria y as podrn tener un mejor futuro. Planea pagar el crdito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fbrica en el aria de produccin, es el ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Hortencia is a single mother; she has two children in her care who will start elementary school this year and she does not have the money she needs to buy uniforms (clothes and shoes) and school supplies (textbooks, notebooks, crayons, sheets of paper, pencils and backpacks.)
She is asking for your cooperation for this loan because she wants her children to go to school and have the necessary education to have a better future.
She plans to repay the loan with part of the salary she earns working in the production department in a factory; this is her familys source of income.

loan.use: to buy school supplies and uniforms.

loan.name: Merlis Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde pocas coloniales se renen cada quince das las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.
En este lugar vive a la seora Merlis, tiene 31 aos de edad, est recin casada hace tres meses y aun no tienen hijos. Estudio en la Universidad y obtuvo el ttulo de Ing. Comercial pero aun no ejerce su profesin. Su esposo es guardia de seguridad.
Ella trabaja de profesora en un jardn de infantes y en un colegio pero tambin se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (artculos de belleza, cosmticos perfumera y accesorios para damas) y ropa de todo tipo. Trabaja todos los das, realiza sus ventas en sus lugares de trabajo y tambin los fines de semana se dedica a recorrer con sus productos los mismos que deja a crdito y cobra cada quince das, lleva ms de 8 aos que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bastante bien.
Este crdito lo va emplear en comprar ms mercadera como: perfumes, cremas, bisutera y ropa de todo tipo. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que la institucin brinda tanto a ella como a sus compaeras del grupo.
Su sueo es tener casa propia ya que vive en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of the Royal Tamarinds, the members of the 5 de Junio (5th of June) Communal Bank meet every 15 days.
Mrs. Merlis lives here. She is 31 years old and recently married (just 3 months ago) and as yet has no children. She studied in the University and obtained the title of Commercial Engineer but does not yet exercise her profession. Her husband is a security guard.
Merlis teaches in a kindergarten and in a private school, and also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, womens' accessories) and clothing of all types. Every day she does sales in her work places and also, on weekends she makes her rounds, selling on credit and collecting each 15 days. Merlis has been doing this for over 8 years and it has gone well for her.
The loan will be used to buy more merchandise, including perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and all types of clothing. Merlis has benefited from 2 loan cycles in her communal bank and she likes the bank for the aid it offers her and the other members of the group.
Merlis' dream is to have her own house, since she lives in her parents' home.

loan.use: buy perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and clothing to sell.

loan.name: Mujeres Cumplidas X Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA "MUJERES CUMPLIDAS X" PORQUE SON UN GRUPO D. PERSONAS MUY CUMPLIDAS QUE EN BASE A LOS PRESTAMOS HAN PODIDO CRECER Y SALIR ADELANTE, UNA D. LA FORMA D. HACERLO ES TRABAJANDO Y SIENDO RESPONSABLES CON TODA LA COMUNIDAD Y SUS FAMILIAS, Y SIENDO CUMPLIDAS EN SU PRESTAMO. EL GRUPO SE LOCALIZA EN EL ESTADO D. PUEBLA EN MXICO. LA SEORA CLAUDIA ES LA PRESIDENTA DEL GRUPO, ELLA TIENE 38 AOS D. EDAD, ES CASADA Y TIENE UNA HIJA D. 15 AOS. ELLA CUENTA CON UN TALLER D. COSTURA EN SU DOMICILIO, COMENTA QUE CON MUCHO ESFUERZO Y DEDICACION HA PODIDO SACAR ADELANTE A SU HIJA PARA QUE SIGA CON SUS ESTUDIOS. ELLA SOLICITA SU PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN SU NEGOCIO AL APROXIMO REGRESO A CLASES YA QUE LE SOLICITAN UNIFORMES ESCOLARES, Y AS COMPRAR TELA E HILOS. CON LAS GANANCIAS SEGUIRA INVIRTIENDO EN SU NEGOCIO, ADEMS D. CONTRIBUIR PARA COMPRAR EL MATERIAL ESCOLAR D. SU HIJA.
texts.en:
This group is called "Mujeres Cumplidas X" (Accomplished Women X) because they are a group of very accomplished people who, based on their loans, have been able to grow and advance. One form of doing this is by working and being responsible and accountable to the entire community and to their families and fulfilling their loan obligations. The group is located in the state of Puebla, in Mexico.
Seora Claudia is the president of the group. She is 38 years old, is married, and has a daughter who is 15. She has a sewing workshop in her home. She comments that with much effort and dedication she has been able to bring up her daughter so that she can continue with her studies. She is applying for the loan to invest in her business for the beginning of the next school year, since she has orders for school uniforms, and so she will buy fabric and thread. With her earnings, she will continue investing in her business and in addition contribute something towards her daughter's school supplies.

loan.use: to buy fabric and thread to make school uniforms.

loan.name: Salvadora

texts.es: Salvadora, vive con su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado y pollo indio, este negocio lo tiene en su casa y tambin sale a vender de forma ambulante, adems vende pozol una vez por semana. Ella est solicitando un prstamo para la compra de pescado, pollo y concentrado para alimentarlos, este prstamo le ayudara para mejorar el negocio y aumentar los productos que tiene a la venta, esperando no tener perdidas con la compra. Su objetivo es mejorar el negocio a travs del financiamiento, aspirando a tener un local fijo en el mercado municipal donde pueda tener mayor afluencia de los clientes.
texts.en:
Salvadora lives with her husband and earns her living by selling fish and native chickens. Her business is located in her home, but she also sells her products as a street vendor. In addition, she sells pozol (a beverage made from corn) once a week.

She is requesting a loan to buy fish, chicken, and concentrated feed for her animals. This loan will help improve her business and increase the number of products that she can sell. Salvadora hopes not to experience any losses as a result of this purchase.

Her goal is to improve her business by utilizing this loan. She aspires to have an established location at the municipal market where she can sell to more customers.

loan.use: to buy fish, chicken, and feed for her animals.

loan.name: Kerlys Elianny

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde pocas coloniales se renen cada quince das las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.
En este lugar vive la seora Kerlys, tiene 30 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tienen un hijo de 14 meses de edad y actualmente est en su 7 mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo es militar.
Nuestra amiga e dedica a la venta productos Avon y Yanbal (artculos de belleza, cosmticos perfumera y accesorios para damas) y ropa por catalogo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella aprovecha sus momentos libres y cuando est desocupada para realizar sus ventas las cuales deja a crdito y cobra semanalmente, dice que le encanta vender, lleva en este negocio 4 aos y le ha ido muy bien.
Este crdito lo va a emplear en comprar perfumes, bisutera, cosmticos, cremas y ropa de todo tipo. Est en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta por la ayuda que dan.
Su sueo es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The June 5th Communal Bank meets every 15 days in Portoviejo, which has been called the City of Los Reales Tamarindos since colonial times.

It is in this place that one can meet Sra. Kerlys. She is 30 years old, married, and has a 14-month-old son. Kerlys is now in her seventh month of pregnancy with her second child. Her husband is in the military.

Kerlys sells products manufactured by Avon and Yanbal, such as beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and womens accessories. She also sells clothing through catalogs. Her sales are conducted by going door-to-door. Kerlys takes advantage of her free time and any moment when she is not busy to make sales. She extends credit to her customers and collects payment on a weekly basis. Kerlys says she enjoys selling and has done very well in the four years she has been in business.

This loan will be used to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crmes, and all types of clothing. She has been with the Communal Bank for three loan cycles and enjoys the assistance that has been given to her. Her dream is to move forward in her business.

loan.use: to buy perfumes, trinkets, cosmetics, crmes, and all types of clothing.

loan.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana, vive con su esposo y tiene 6 hijos de 30, 27, 26, 21, 18 y 10 aos de edad, ella administra una tienda donde ofrece artculos de primera necesidad, la inicio hace 10 aos su madre y posteriormente fue heredado, trabaja todos los das de lunes a domingo. Ella est solicitando un prstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite y boquitas, este prstamo le ayudara para fortalecer el negocio y mejorar su inventario para poder atender la demanda de los clientes. Su aspiracin es mantener el negocio y que sus hijos terminen las carreras acadmicas, para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her husband and they have six children (ages 30, 27, 26, 21, 18, and 10). She manages a store where she offers basic necessities. Ana started this business 10 years ago with her mother and later inherited all of the responsibilities. She works every day, Monday through Sunday.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, and snacks. This loan will help strengthen her business and improve her inventory so that she can meet the demand of her customers.

Her aspiration is to maintain her business so that her children can finish their academic degrees and become successful.

loan.use: to purchase rice, beans, oil, and snacks.

loan.name: Enita Estrella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde pocas coloniales se renen cada quince das las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.
La seora Enita es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la secretaria y le gusta porque los intereses son ms bajos que en otras instituciones de crdito. Tiene 51 aos de edad, est casada y de esta relacin tiene 5 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, la mayor de ellos aun vive con ella y estudia en universidad. Su esposo ya no trabaja por enfermedad. Hace varios aos aprendi corte y confeccin en una academia en Portoviejo.
Ella tiene un pequeo taller de costura en su casa donde desde hace muchos aos se dedica a coser todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su casa. Trabaja todos los das desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta ms tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, su hija le ayuda cuando est desocupada. Lleva ms de 20 aos dedicada a esta actividad.
Este nuevo crdito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura.
Su sueo es tener un taller ms grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks in Portoviejo, known since colonial times as the City of the "Reales Tamarindos," the members of the June 5th Communal Bank meet.
Enita is a founding member of the communal bank as well as the secretary, and she likes the bank because the interest is much lower than other lending institutions. She is 51 years old, married, and has 5 children from this union, all of whom are grown. The oldest daughter still lives with her and studies at the university. Her husband no longer works due to illness. Many years ago, she learned clothing cutting and assembling at an academy in Portoviejo.
She has a small sewing workshop in her house where for many years she has sewn all kinds of clothing, based on orders from private individuals who come to her house. She works every day from 6 am until 10 pm, and at times even later when she has orders to complete. Her daughter helps her when she has time. She has done this work for more than 20 years.
She is going to use this new loan to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, closures and other sewing supplies.
Her dream is to have a larger workshop.

loan.use: to purchase cloth, thread, buttons, closures, and other sewing supplies.

loan.name: Jos Guadalupe

texts.es: El seor Jos Guadalupe y su esposa la seora Jovana tiene ya mas de tres aos dedicndose a la venta de ropa usada y artculos de bebe en diferentes partes de la ciudad. Estn solicitando un prstamo para invertir en compra de mercanca que es ropa para dama y caballero, zapatos, aparatos electrnicos (planchas, licuadoras, tostadores y cafeteras) pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para l inversin que desean hacer le a su negocio. Planea pagar el crdito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio y que los gastos familiares y escolares de sus tres hijos los cubrir con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como oficial vehicular de la ciudad. Desea darles lo mejor y sacar a delante a su familia.
texts.en:
For more than three years Jos Guadalupe and his wife, Jovana, have sold used clothing and baby items in different parts of the city.
They would like to invest in purchasing merchandise such as women's and men's clothing, shoes, and small appliances (irons, blenders, toasters, and coffeemakers) but they don't have the necessary capital, so they are requesting a loan to make this investment in their business.
He plans to repay the loan with the earnings from his business, and to cover the family expenses and school expenses for his three children with the income from his job as a traffic officer for the city.
He wants to give his family the best and help them get ahead.

loan.use: to invest in purchasing merchandise for his business.

loan.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es: Jos, vive con su familia, su esposa y tres hijos de 12, 8 y 5 aos de edad, ellos dependen directamente de l, Jos es carpintero y elabora especficamente atades, aprendi desde joven, su padre le enseo el oficio. Actualmente solicita un prstamo para la compra de madera, pintura y barniz, este prstamo le ayudara para tener en la carpintera los materiales que son ms usados para fabricar los atades, dando as un mejor servicio a los clientes y saliendo con todos los pedidos. Su aspiracin es incrementar el trabajo en el taller, con mayor nmero de materiales y con ms afluencia de clientes.
texts.en:
Jos lives with his family, his wife and three children ages 5, 8, and 12, who depend entirely on him. Jos is a carpenter making coffins. He learned the work from his father when he was young.
Right now he is requesting a loan to purchase wood, paint, and varnish. This loan will help him to have the materials most often used for making coffins in his carpentry shop, so he can offer his customers better service and get more orders.
His hope is to increase the work in his shop, with a greater amount of materials and an abundance of customers.

loan.use: to purchase wood, paint, and varnish.

loan.name: Las Coquetas 1 Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama las "Coquetas 1" y se ubica en el estado de Morelos, en Mexico. Esta comunidad se distingue por su Hacienda y un acueducto importante en la epoca colonial porque abastecia de agua al pueblo, y tambien por su fiesta celebre que es el 30 de agosto donde llega gente de diferentes lugares a celebrar juntos al santo patrn del pueblo, el grupo esta conformado por 14 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamo. Mara es integrante del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de perfumes y servilletas, negocio que inicio hace 7 aos, solicita el prestamo para comprar perfumes y sevilletas de tela. Ella tiene 63 aos, estudio hasta el terecer ao de secundaria, es divorciada y tiene en total 4 hijos 2 mujeres y 2 varones, al momento de solicitar el prestamo se siente contenta porque podra tener mas variedad de perfumes, tambien espera con las ganancias empezar los cimientos de la barda de su casa.
texts.en:
This group is called "Coquetas 1" (Coquettes 1) and is located in the state of Morelos in Mexico. This community stands out for their hacienda; their aquaduct, which was important in the colonial era because it supplied the village with water; and their famous festival, where people from different areas come together to celebrate the patron saint of the village on the 30th August.
This group is made up of fourteen members and this is the first time they have applied for a loan. Maria, a member of this group, has worked selling perfumes and napkins for seven years. She is applying for a loan to purchase perfumes and linen napkins. Maria is 63 years old and studied up until Year 9 of high school. She is divorced and has four children, two girls and two boys. At the time of applying for the loan she felt happy because she will be able to have a greater variety of perfumes. She also hopes that with her income she will be able to begin work on the foundations of the wall of her house.

loan.use: to purchase perfume and linen napkins

loan.name: Kelly Gisella

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde pocas coloniales se renen cada quince das las socias del Banco Comunal 5 De Junio.
En este lugar vive la Seora Kelly, tiene 24 aos de edad, est soltera y vive en la casa de los padres. Estudia Auditoria en la Universidad aunque ya tiene un titulo de Lic. En Idiomas.
Nuestra amiga es maestra en una Unidad educativa pero tambin se dedica al comercio, vende productos Avon (artculos de belleza, cosmticos perfumera y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los das en ambas actividades ya que ella aprovecha para vender sus productos en la escuela en la que trabaja y en la universidad donde estudia, lleva dos aos que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido bastante bien. Lo que ms vende son los maquillajes.
Este crdito lo va emplear en comprar ms mercadera como: perfumes, cremas, cosmticos y bisutera. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco comunal, antes estaba en otro pero como este quedaba ms cerca de su casa se cambio y le gusta cmo trabajan en la institucin.
Sus sueos son seguir adelante en su negocio y conseguir un nombramiento de maestra.
texts.en: The communal lender "5 de Junio" meets twice a month in the colonial city of Portoviejo. Kelly is 24, single and lives with her parents in this city. She is studying auditing in the university, and holds a degree in languages. Kelly teaches in a school and also sells Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume and women's accessories). She works every day and sells products both on the school and university campuses, and has done so for the past two years, with great success in selling cosmetics. Kelly seeks this credit to buy an inventory of perfumes, skin creams, cosmetics and accessories and hopes to grow her business as well as attain success as a teacher.

loan.use: to buy perfumes, skin cremes, cosmetics and accessories

loan.name: Margarita

texts.es: La seora Margarita est solicitando un prstamo para empezar la construccin de un cuarte de material ya que actual mente la vivienda que tiene es de madera y esta en muy malas condiciones. Con el prstamo comprar el material para la construccin que block, cemento, varilla y arena. Ya que no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la nueva construccin de la vivienda. Doa Margarita se dedica a la costura y con este ingreso pagara el crdito, ya que su esposo el seor Andrs se encargara de los gastos familiares. La seora Margarita y el seor Andrs son ya personas de mayores de edad y viven solos.
texts.en:
Margarita is asking for a loan to start building a room out of better materials because her house is currently made of wood and its in very bad condition. She will use the loan to buy concrete blocks, cement, iron rods and sand because she does not have the necessary funds to do the new construction on the dwelling.
Margarita is a Seamstress and will use income from this work to repay the loan since her husband, Andrs, will see to family expenses. Margarita and Andrs are older adults and live alone.

loan.use: to build a room.

loan.name: Paulo Mata Hernandez

texts.es: A la vivienda del seor Paulo le est haciendo falta los acabados del exterior y elaborar la bardal alrededor de su casa. Esta solicitando un prstamo para poder comparar el material para la constriccin que es cemento, pintura, block, arena y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora. Don Paulo no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la construccin y le preocupa la seguridad y proteccin de su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. Planea pagar el crdito con una parte del sueldo que recibe como chofer de un taxi, es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en: Paulos house still needs the finishing touches to the exterior and a perimeter wall around it. Hes asking for a loan to buy building materials and supplies for this construction project: cement, paint, concrete blocks and sand and to pay labor costs to the person who will do the work. Paulo does not have enough money to do the project and hes concerned about his wifes and his four childrens safety and protection. He plans to repay the loan with part of the salary he earns as a Taxi Driver, which is the source of income he has to provide the best for his family.

loan.use: to finish the exterior of the house and build a perimter wall.

loan.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch and her husband work hard to support their children in their education. Presently, they have seven children. One of them is married and lives separately. Currently, she is a corn seller in a market near her community. She earns about $4 per day. She would like a loan of $1,200 in order to repair their old and damaged house.

loan.use: To repair their old and run-down house.

loan.name: Hang

texts.en: Mrs. Hang and her husband work hard to improve their familys standard of living and to support the education of their two children. She is a clothes sewer near her house, and earns about $5 per day. Her husband is an official in a Cambodian ministry and makes $3 per day. They request a loan of $1,000 to purchase a new motorbike for supporting on her business.

loan.use: to purchase a new motorbike to support her clothing business

loan.name: Emelson

texts.en:
Emelson is 35 years old and is married with three children. He earns about 30,000 PHP each season as a rice farmer working in the Philippines. Emelson has been growing rice for the past 13 years.
Emelson is requesting a loan to pay for farm inputs such as seed, fertilizer, and insecticide that are necessary in farming. In the future, he hopes to diversify his business in order to generate more income and save for emergencies.

loan.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and insecticide

loan.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a married woman with two children who attend school. She is 42 years old and, for almost 20 years, has run a business where she sells food and fish to the people in her community. She has used the income generated from her business for school fees.
Marilyn is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan to purchase fish, beef, and pork, and to add vegetables to her food offerings. This will help increase her sales. In the future, Marilyn hopes to diversify her business and generate more income to be able to continuously send her children to school to earn their degrees and have a brighter future.

loan.use: to purchase fish, beef, and pork, and add vegetables to her food offerings to increase sales

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to repair her old house

loan.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 55 years old and has seven children. Four of them are attending school, and the others have settled into marriage and live separately from him. Martin still works hard to sustain his family through farming. He has worked as a farmer for the past 30 years and is determined to do the best to improve his yield with every harvest. He earns an average income of 30,000 PHP during each harvest season, usually between April and November of each year.
Martin is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farming production. With the help of this loan, he hopes to grow his farming operations and continue to support the complete education of his children.

loan.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loan.name: Buth

texts.en: Mrs. Buth and her husband have two children. She earns $3.5 a day selling smoked fish in the market near her home. She would like a loan of $600 to purchase a store at Kompong Speu market. She will use the additional income to support her children's educational achievement.

loan.use: to purchase a store at Kompong Speu market.

loan.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years now. She works hard to support her family. Elsie has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment for her business.

loan.name: Im

texts.en: Mrs. Im would like to support the educational achievement of her child. She is a widow with one child wH. works as a sewing factory worker in Phnom Penh. She would like to borrow $600 in order to purchase a new motorbike for personal use.

loan.use: to purchase a new motorbike for personal use.

loan.name: Shirley

texts.en: Shirley is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 21 years. Shirley is borrowing 13,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall. She earns extra income from a general store. Shirley has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loan.name: Dam

texts.en: Mrs. Dam works as a fish seller in her village to support her family. In addition, she works as a farmer. She is a widow with four children, but now three of them are married and live separately. Mrs. Dam wishes to borrow $600 to build a new house.

loan.use: to build a new house.

loan.name: Susanita

texts.en: Susanita is 45 years old, married, has three children and earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been in this line of work for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 25,000 from NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She earns additional income by farming rice, and is working hard to achieve her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies for her farm.

loan.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is 45 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with three children. For the past 15 years, Vicente has managed a hog-raising business situated in his village. Aside from managing livestock, he cultivates rice while his wife manages a sari-sari" store (a community-based retail store). Vicente sells his hogs after raising them for four months to earn 3,000 PHP. He has used this income to provide for his children and their daily needs.
Vicente is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy feed to maintain his pigs. His dream is to increase his business to be better able to support his family and meet their needs. This loan will mean a lot to him if he is given the chance.

loan.use: to buy feed to maintain his pigs

loan.name: Ella

texts.en: Ella is 59 years old, married and has three children. She works very hard to provide for her family by running a sari-sari (or variety) store in the Philippines, and has applied for a loan for PHP 20,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has run her store for five years and earns most of her income by selling soap, sugar, soft drinks and other groceries. Her goal for the future is to set aside enough money to continue expanding her business.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Ananias

texts.en: Ananias is 48 years old and single. He works in the agricultural business raising livestock in the Philippines. Ananias has requested a loan of 19,500 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to buy livestock such as pigs, goats, and chickens. Ananias has been raising livestock for eight years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business. He would like to build and expand his business to secure the future of his family.

loan.use: to buy livestock such as pigs, goats, and chickens.

loan.name: Uk

texts.en: Mr. Uk and his wife work hard to support their family through their farming business. They earn approximately $3 per day. They have eleven children. Five are now married and living separately. They would like a loan of $500 to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and other farming materials for the upcoming planting season.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizer and other materials.

loan.name: Yin

texts.en: To earn daily revenue, Mrs. Yin always goes to busy market for selling a few kinds of fresh fish. She has run this business since 2005, and is earning an income around $5USD a day to cover her family expenses. Presently, she lives in a small house which has located in Reussey Keo commune. She has four children; one is single and also her in fish-selling business while the rest three are already married and living in other houses. Her husband always generates his income by providing a motor taxi service, is making a profit about $5USD per day to share responsibility with Mrs. Yin also. As the family wish to increase their profits, Mrs. Yin and her husband have decided to borrow some loan fund for HKL and Kiva to buy potato seeds for planting in Pursat Province.

loan.use: to buy potato seeds for planting.

loan.name: Irenea

texts.en: Irenea is 56 years old and married with two children. Irenea works very hard to provide for them. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase more stock to sell. Irenea has been in this business for ten years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, snack food, and other miscellaneous items. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide financial stability for her family.

loan.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loan.name: Corazon

texts.en: Corazon is single and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years. She works hard to support her family. Corazon has requested a loan of 29,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat. In the future, Corazon would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase a new engine for her fishing boat.

loan.name: Nenita

texts.en: Nenita is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for seven years. Nenita works hard to support her family. Nenita has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP through Kiva partner, NWTF, to purchase fishing gear and equipment. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money to provide good living conditions for her family.

loan.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loan.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old and is a married woman who raises pigs to support her family and provide for their basic needs. She is a blessed mother of three children and her hardworking husband is a carpenter. During six years of raising hogs, Merlinda has been able to earn a net income of 1,000 PHP.
Merlinda is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy a piglet and feed for her livestock. She believes this loan will greatly help to improve her business and provide a larger income to meet her familys needs.

loan.use: to buy a piglet and pig feed

loan.name: Serafina

texts.en:
Serafina is a hard-working mother who is now 47 years old with five school-aged children. She is a farmer working in the Philippines who earns 9,000 PHP a month. Despite hardships in life, she is strongly determined to improve her familys living standard and to give her children a better future.

Serafina is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to be used to pay for labor to prepare her land for planting and purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops. She is hoping to have a plentiful harvest in order to earn more income to satisfy her familys daily basic needs and to finance the education of her children.

Serafina believes that with patience and strong determination and the continuous assistance of ASKI and Kiva lenders she will be able to achieve her goals.

loan.use: to pay for labor to prepare her land and purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her crops.

location.town: Brgy. Munguia, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loan.name: Godofredo

texts.en:
Godofredo is 52 years old, married and blessed with five children. For three years he has farmed rice as well as raised pigs. He is able to earn an average net income of 20,000 PHP.

Godofredos earnings are too low to provide sufficiently for the needs of his family, such as allowances and tuition fees for his children currently attending school. Because of this, Godofredo is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP. Strongly determined, Godofredo will use this loan to develop his rice field to improve his rice production by buying an array of fertilizers and other farming needs and to pay for the cost of labor needed to work on his farm.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and other farming needs and to pay for needed labor.

loan.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
Gulmira is the leader of this group. She is 47 and married to a welder. Together with her husband she has raised two sons and a daughter. The first son works in construction, the second goes to school and the daughter is at university.

In order to earn money to meet the familys daily needs, Gulmira sells flour. With her profits she has been able to provide her children with a good education. She also purchased an old Soviet Moskvich car for the family.

Gulmira has applied for this loan because she needs additional funds to repair her house. In the future she wants to expand her flour business.

loan.use: to repair her house.

loan.name: Yadamsuren

texts.en:
Yadamsuren, 28 years old, is an young man who is trying to build his own family life. He lives with his wife, 26, and daughter, one year old, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He has been running a taxi business since 2009.

This year, he and his wife decided to sell some dairy products during Naadam, a Mongolian national holiday. But to do so they need a big-sized ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic tent. Its recent market price is a little bit expensive, so he needs financial aid to start up this new business.

Thus, Yadamsuren is taking a loan to purchase a ger for his new business. Let's support him, please!

loan.use: to purchase a ger for his new business.

loan.name: Lorren

texts.en:
Lorren is 32 years old and married with one child. He is a farmer in the Philippines who earns an average net profit of 50,000 PHP every April and November harvest season. He has been farming for two years and has been able to familiarize himself with farming practices, yet he knows he still has a lot of things to learn in order to generate a big yield.

Lorren is asking for a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase the seed, fertilizers and insecticides necessary for crop production. He believes this loan will enable him to meet his familys needs, such as supplying enough food and achieving renovations on their house.

Lorren aspires for a better family life; thus, he works hard to grow his farming income.

loan.use: to purchase the seed, fertilizers and insecticides necessary for crop production.

loan.name: Florencia

texts.en: Florencia is 48 years old. She is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Married as she is, Florencia is struggling hard to provide for her four dependents' needs personal, school, everything. She tries to meet these demands by operating a retail store, which she started ten years ago. Luckily, she earns a monthly income of 4,000 PHP from it. In 2008, Florencia joined Kiva partner, GDMPC. This time, she has applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP from the cooperative, which is her third time of borrowing. The money is intended to buy daily use commodities to sell in her retail store. Florencia hopes for a consistent business operation and the opportunity to earn more income.

loan.use: to buy daily use commodities to sell in her retail store.

loan.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is married with four children. His rice field was inherited from his parents, and he has been cultivating the farm for twenty years now. Great improvements in his farm will mean a lot to his family, especially his children for whom he wants a comfortable life.

Last harvest, Alex generated 15,000 PHP net income from his yield. This was low when compared to his familys daily expenditures, so he decided to apply for a loan that would help him improve his yield next harvest.

Alexs loan will be used to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizers and insecticides to use in his rice field to ensure a better yield. For his part, he is determined to utilize the loan wisely and see to it that his farm is doing great.

Alex said he will do his best to improve his farming not just for a prosperous life, but also to pay tribute to his parents for entrusting him with the farm for which they have worked many long years.

loan.use: to purchase hybrid seed, fertilizers and insecticides to use in his rice field.

loan.name: Enkhtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs. Enkhtsetseg, 28, is a hard-working woman who lives with her husband and two daughters in a ger, the traditional nomadic Mongolian tent. She has been operating a clothing-sales business since 2005 and now owns four booths there, having begun with just one.

Enkhtsetseg wants to expand her business by increasing the variety of her goods and is therefore requesting a loan to purchase new kinds of clothes to sell.

loan.use: to purchase some new clothes to expand her business.

loan.name: Damira

texts.en:
Damira is 41 years old, she is married and is raising three children. She was born in the village of Bakai-Ata where she now lives with her family.
In 2000 Damira opened her own store in her own home and started her business in retail. At this time her store is one of the popular places which provides groceries and consumer goods for the fellow villagers.
As energetic as she is Damira also plows the land of 3.20 hectares, where she grows beans, potatoes and perennial grasses. Thanks to her hard work and a wide range of business activity she was able to save money for her son's tuition in the medical university.
For the further growth of her business and increase of sales Damira has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 KGS. She plans to invest the profit into her children's education.
ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loan.use: to expand the variety of products

loan.name: Fayzullo

texts.en: Fayzullo lives in the region of Dangara. He is 40 years old. He is married and has seven children. His wife is a homemaker and his children go to secondary school. Fayzullo does sales on the market. He has been in the sales of flour for more than six years. He is taking out the loan to buy flour in wholesale. He wants to increase his sales volume.

loan.use: to buy flour in wholesale

loan.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida and husband, blessed with three children, is 52 years old and has been engaged in farming for 35 years now. For each harvest (April and November), she is able to earn an average of P25,000. She also manages a furniture-making business.

Although the businesses help her and her husband pay for the necessities at home, weather challenges such as typhoons and drought have adversely affected her business capital. For this reason, Aida is requesting a loan of P25,000 to buy farm inputs such fertilizers and insecticides and pay farm labor costs. She will also use part of the loan to purchase some tools for her furniture shop.

loan.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and insecticides and pay farm labor costs.

loan.name: Miswalehe

texts.en: Miswalehe is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one has graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past ten years, Miswalehe has operated a street food-selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to become self reliant in the future. With the Kshs 40,000 Miswalehe wants to establish a stall for selling food, and purchase sacks of beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To establish a stall for selling food, and sacks of beans and rice.

loan.name: Davronbek

texts.en:
ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners sincerely thanks social lenders and Kiva for its comprehensive support and assistance in the financing of its borrowers. Thanks to your efforts Davronbek is successfully growing his cattle breeding business which allowed him to pay off his first Kiva loan without delinquencies.
Davronbek was born in the town of Osh in the Osh province of the Kyrgyz Republic. He is married and is raising two children.
Davronbek was born in the family of a farmer. Since childhood Davronbek helped his father take care of the cattle. At that time his father had a large household and needed help and this is why Davronbek got used to this type of business and dreamed that when he grew up he will also have his own cattle business.
After graduating from school Davronbek went to serve in the army. In 1995 when he was 23 years old Davronbek got married and in the same year his first son was born. Later in 1998 he had a daughter.
During the first years Davronbek lived with his family and in his parents' home. Gradually by breeding and selling large horned cattle he was able to save money. In 2002 he decided to invest the money in purchase of his own house in the village of Chaldovar in the Panfilovsky region, Chuysk Province, Republic of Kyrgyzstan where he moved to live. In some time his parents sold out all their cattle and bought a house in the village of Chaldovar where they moved to live not far from their son.
At this time because of his entrepreneurship and tenacity Devronbek has five milk cows and two calves. For the purpose of increasing the headcount of cattle Davronbek has come to Bai-Tushum and Partners to take out a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS. Davronbek dreams to buy a house in the town of Karabalta and move there in the future because the town has good schools, a hospital and a cattle market.
ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners provides loans through Kiva for socially vulnerable population regions. ZAO MFK Bai Tushum & Partners is one of the leading micro financing organizations in Kyrgyzstan. Bai Tushum & Partners is a reliable financial partner which makes an impact in development of the economy in the Republic of Kyrgyzstan, provides affordable micro lending services in the rural towns and cities, helps to create jobs and is responsible for the interests of their clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Edreda

texts.en: Edreda is a 36-year-old married woman with three children living in her own permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her major dream is to educate her children to attain a degree as a minimum qualification. She sells home utensils and fresh foods for a living and has been in business for four years. Her major constraint now is high transportation prices, which in turn affects the demand power of her customers. Edreda needs the loan to buy home products such as flasks and cup to sell.

loan.use: To buy home products such as flasks and cups to sell.

loan.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, 52 years old, is married to Homer. The couple is blessed with four children, generally in their adult age now. Vilma and husband patiently maintain their livelihood to support their needs and save for future expenses.
She manages a rice field while Homer (husband) manages their transport motorcycle. She is grateful for the business for she is able to earn PHP 20,000 average net income from her rice production.
She is requesting a loan of PHP 18,000 to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay for the labor cost in the preparation and maintenance of her rice crop. She hopes to make her business more productive for future emergencies.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticides and pay labor costs for preparation and maintenance of her rice crop

loan.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 36-year-old married man with four children living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His dream is to own rental houses in Fort Portal town. He sells used shoes and has been in this business for two years. His major setback is the ever-rising prices of products. His dream is to import shoes himself. Paul needs the loan to buy second hand shoes to sell.

loan.use: To buy second hand shoes to sell

loan.name: Muzaffar

texts.en: Muzaffar lives in the region of Dangara. He is 50 years old. He is married and has three children. His wife is a homemaker. His oldest son is now working in Russia. Muzaffar is in sales. In the village of Gichovak he has own store where he sells food and groceries. He has been in this business for four years. His daughter and son help in the growth of his business. He is taking out the loan to buy flour, milk products and a refrigerator.

loan.use: to buy flour, milk products and a refrigerator

loan.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. For the past four years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Rose dreams of expanding her business to earn more profits in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loan.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, cooking oil and rice.

loan.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, separated, is 63 years old. She is blessed with four children. Erlinda has been managing her rice field for almost 50 years. The farming business is her way of supporting her family. Her income from the business helped her raise her children well.
She is asking for a loan of PHP 27,000 to acquire fertilizers, insecticides and seeds. She will also pay the labor fees spent for tilling, sowing, pulling and transplanting her rice crop.
She hopes to further support her family without her husband's assistance. She strongly believed that through hard work and patience, she could give all her children a bright future.

loan.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides and seeds.

loan.name: Otgonganbat

texts.en:
Otgonganbat is 42 years old, married to Munkhjargal, a 45-year-old woman. Their marriage has been blessed with two children, Uyanga, aged 21, a university student, and Khansumberel, a seven year-old son who attends primary school. The family lives in a small house in the outer district of Ulaanbaatar. Munkhjargal has been operating fruit wholesale business at Bars, a local outdoor market, since 1999. She imports her products from Ereen, the border city of China, and sells to local stores and outside of the city as well. Her business has been developing considerably during the last few years hence she has a large number of constant customers.
Otgonganbat is requesting 3.700.000.00 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to cover his house with bricks and block stones. Since the temperature goes below -40 C during the winter time in Ulaanbaatar, he wants to make his small house warm and cozy.
Otgonganbat graduated from the Railway University and National Academy of Governance in 2005. Since then he has been working as an engineer at Ulaanbaatar Train Station. He is a hard-working, responsible and trusted client of our institute who is very thankful for the lenders for giving him an opportunity to improve his familys living standard.

loan.use: to buy essential materials to renovate his small house

loan.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a farmer who has lived in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. She has two single children who are enrolled in school. Her husband works a driver in a private company who serves tourist-service. He could be earned about $8 per day for his job. Currently, her husband always goes to achieve his work by hiring motor taxi, and sometime he missed his work because of nothing vehicle to travel. To solve this problem, Mrs. Sam and her husband are looking for a loan in amount of $600 in order to purchase second motorbike. With this, it will decrease the traveling expense and also to make easier with their traveling need when they need to go anywhere.
For her future expectation, Mrs. Sam wishes to buy a cow for breeding, to reconstruct a bigger house, and to send her kids to study in university.

loan.use: to purchase a new motorbike for her husband.

loan.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food. For the past year, he has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business, operating from the market. He faces a major challenge of competition from other boda boda businesses. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 Francis wants to purchase two tires, a chain box and rim to repair his motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loan.use: To purchase two tires, a chain box and rim to repair his motorcycle.

loan.name: Kuy

texts.en: Mrs. Kuy, 40, is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for many years. She also relies on income from her husbands work, fish trading. He normally needs to reserve a section of the pond where small fish grow, and he also catches them to sell when the fish are mature. They have given birth to five children, all of whom are single and living under a roof with them. As this is a rainy season, it is so good with planting all kinds of crop but she lack money to start to grow. Therefore, Mrs. Kuy would like to request some funds from Kiva to purchase corn seeds, peanut seed and fertilizers. She hopes she can use the remainders fund to buy additional a small fishes for continuing feeding.

loan.use: to purchase corn seeds, peanut seeds and fertilizers.

loan.name: Rajabmoh

texts.en: Rajabmoh lives in Dangara. She is 51 years old. She is married. She has two children. She and her husband are retired. Rajabmoh works in trade. Five years ago, she opened a grocery store. Today she continues to work there. Her children also work in trade. She is taking out a loan to buy tea, sugar, beverages, butter, chocolates, crackers, and pasta.

loan.use: to buy tea, sugar, beverages, butter, chocolates, crackers, and pasta.

loan.name: Nhean

texts.en: Mrs. Nhean, age 35, is a humble villager who lives in Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Nhean is a coal seller in her community and she lives with four single children. She is a widow woman. Her husband passed away for a long time ago. From her business, she earns an income about $3.50 USD per day. Presently, Mrs. Nhean would like to apply for a loan in amount of $600 to decorate some parts of her old house.

loan.use: to decorate some parts of her old house.

loan.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. She has had a shop that sells canned goods, detergents, and snacks for two years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy more canned goods, detergents, and beverages. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Myrna hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, detergents and beverages

loan.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is 38 years old, married and the father of two children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by running a retail shop where he earns about KES 5,000 a month, all of which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he learned about from a friend who is a member. He will use the loan to buy more items, including sugar, rice and wheat flour, to sell to his customers. With the additional income made possible by this loan, he plans to go into the business of selling kerosene. His hope is to open a wholesale business and improve his family's living standards.

loan.use: To buy sugar, rice and wheat flour to sell to his customers.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy snacks, beverages and detergent to sell to her customers.

loan.name: Sicily

texts.en: Sicily, a 39-year-old single mother of two children, has been running a pharmacy for 14 years. A monthly income of KES 7,000 allows her to support her children. Sicily is applying for her second loan with KADET LTD to increase her stock of medicines. She will use the anticipated additional profit to benefit her children, for whom she hopes to provide a stable life and a good education.

loan.use: to increase her stock of medicines.

loan.name: Chhan

texts.en: Mrs. Chann has resided of Siem Reap Province since she was single. She is a mother of two single children, and lives with under her responsible. Mrs. Chann employed as a chief in France restaurant and she can get a specific salary every month. She also has her husband who always generates some incomes from his business as a motor taxi driver. He could be earned about $2.5 per day. Mrs. Chann requeted a loan in order to build a new hedge of her house as it is getting old and broken also.

loan.use: to build a new hedge of her house.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase bundles of clothes to sell

loan.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia, who is 36 years old, is married to a farmer named Roderick. Together, they raise their two children in their peaceful village in Cagayan Province. Sylvia wants a life that is comfortable and prosperous so with Roderick, they manage well their livelihood in farming hand in hand.
She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to pay for land cultivation and to purchase the seeds, fertilizers and insecticides she needs for farming. This loan, she believes will be a great help towards a better yield.
Sylvia aspires that someday, she will able to continuously send her children to school until college. They'd be very grateful if that happens, said Sylvia.

loan.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loan.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 49 years old and married to Rael who is a farmer. They are blessed with seven children. He has been a carpenter for four years with a monthly income of KES 5,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD. Samuel will use the loan to buy timber for making furniture and carpentry tools.
With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope is concentrated more on his childrens education.

loan.use: To buy timber

loan.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
Gloria has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & beverages. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks.
Gloria has been a member of HSPFI since 2006. In the future, Gloria hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, detergents & snacks

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 26 years old and is married with one child who is three years old. She earns a living by selling goods such as lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on. This is her second successful year in this business. Her business is well organized. She operates her business from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day except on Saturday. She employs one person to help her.
Florence has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing more lotions, soap, sugar, salt and so on for resale. By adding more goods and workers, she hopes to earn more profit. With this profit, she will save for her family, reinvest in her business, and renovate her house.

loan.use: To purchase more goods to sell, such as lotions, soap, and sugar

loan.name: Phork

texts.en: Mr. Phork is an older woman who has been living in the Siem Reap Province. Mr. Phork has learned how to combine different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and he uses his knowledge to earn an income in order to meet the needs of the family. Mr. Phork also travels to sell his medicine by walking around her community. He now has four single kids who live with him. Aside this, Mr. Phork also assists his wife with planting a few crops on their existing farmland. The coming rainfall is good for their crops. However, Mr. Phork and his wife dont have capital yet to use on their farm. So, Mr. Phork is looking for a loan to use towards purchasing insecticides and potato seeds for planting.

loan.use: to purchase insecticides and potato seeds for planting.

loan.name: Winlight

texts.en:
Winlight is 23 years old and supports his mother. He buys and sells second-hand clothing. He has been in the business for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 6000.
Winlight has borrowed a loan of KES10,000 from KADET. This being his first loan, he hopes to use the loan to purchase a bale of t-shirts for resale.
The profits will be used to purchase more clothing for the business. He hopes to live a happy life and to prosper in his business.

loan.use: to purchase one bale of secondhand t-shirts.

loan.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.
Saturnina has a shop where she sells hypo or cleansing solutions by the liter. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy raw materials needed for making the hypo or cleansing solutions.
Saturnina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Saturnina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw materials needed for making hypo or cleansing solutions.

loan.name: Yean

texts.en: Mrs. Yean, 33, is a married woman and the mother of three children, all of whom are single and living under her care. Her husband is Sodey 35, a local fisherman in his community. Mrs. Yean makes a living by selling fresh fish and vegetables in a very busy local market. She is an energetic and determined woman who has worked hard to earn enough money to feed all her children since they were very young. Mrs. Yeans husband is concerned that his existing boat is broken now and he couldnt use it to support him in fishing activity as before. That is why Mrs. Yean is applying for this loan to buy a new boat for her husband in fishing purpose.

loan.use: to purchase a new boat.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loan.name: Kizota Group

texts.en:
Janeth, who is in her early 30's, is married. She has two children who go to school. She has been running a business of selling fabrics, shoes and hand bags, from door to door for 5 years now. She works from 8 a.m to 12 a.m (works for four hrs. only) daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
This will be Janeth's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her inventory from just the fabrics to start selling shoes and hand bags. She also paid school fees and household expenses. Janeth has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more fabrics, bags and shoes to sell.
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Kizota", which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loan.use: to buy more fabrics, bags and shoes to sell.

loan.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 27 years old. He is married and has one child, 2 years old. Philippe has been selling goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, sugar, biscuits, etc. for one year. His business is well-organized and he works daily from 8am until 7pm, every day except on Saturday. He currently employs one person to help him.
Philippe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders, via Vision Finance Company, in order to expand his business by purchasing more and various goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, biscuits, sugar, etc. for resale. With any profits, he plans to reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loan.use: to purchase various goods such as: soap, lotions, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy more livestock for sale

loan.name: Rufino

texts.en:
Rufino lives in Cagayan. He is married and blessed with three children. He is engaged in a farming business. He raises crops, primarily planting and harvesting rice for future merchandise to generate income and provide sustenance for his family. Each cropping season (April and November), Rufino earns approximately PHP 35,000 average net income.
Rufino is now asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides used in his rice farming. He hopes this loan will grow his business operation.
In the future, Rufino would like to strengthen and diversify his business in order to provide productive living for his family.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loan.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 26 years old and supports two members of his family. He buys and sells second hand clothing and has been in the business for a period of two years earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.
He has borrowed a loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD. This is his first term loan and hopes to use the money to purchase a bale of quality jean trousers and tshirts.
The profits will be used to start a barber shop and purchase a lead battery charger for his business.He hopes to be self sustainable and improve the welfare of his family.

loan.use: To purchase more bales of second hand clothing

loan.name: Norjana

texts.en: Norjana is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Norjana has a shop that sells snacks, beverages and canned goods. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks. Norjana has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Norjana hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, beverages and snacks

loan.name: Zacheus

texts.en:
Zacheus is 25 years old and married. They are blessed with two children, ages four and two. He is a tailor and has been in the business for a period of eight years earning a monthly income of KES.10,000.
He has borrowed a loan of KES.10,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use the money to purchase sewing threads and materials for the business. The anticipated profit will be used to improve business and also meet the welfare of his family.
His dream is to own a retail shop.

loan.use: To purchase sewing threads and materials

loan.name: Duch

texts.en: Mrs. Duch, 52, is a married woman who now lives in the Siem Reap Province. To earn a living, she plants different kinds of crop on her own land. Mrs. Duch always tries all her best to feed all the children to live in a proper life as the other villagers. Her husband is also a rice farmer. The couple earns about $6 per day from their business. They have given birth to six children in response. But now two of them are married and stay in separately house. Mrs. Duch and her husband would like to loan in amounts of $1,100 in order to purchase two cows for breeding.

loan.use: to purchase two cows for breeding.

loan.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. Mariam has a tailoring shop that repairs and sews office and school uniforms. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy materials needed like cloth. Mariam has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Mariam hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy materials such as cloth

loan.name: Janerose

texts.en:
Janerose is a 40-year-old married woman with eight children living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of educating her children.
She owns motorcycles for transport as a source of income. She started this business three years ago and her major problem is failure of hired riders to remit money on time.
In spite of this, she still feels the business is worth doing and she desires to own at least ten motorcycles.
Janerose needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loan.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: To buy goods like soap, sugar and beans for resale at her retail shop

loan.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 48 years old, married and has six children. She has had a piggery business for six years and generates PHP 5,000 after selling two pigs every four months.
She is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to make further improvements to her livestock shelter. She will also buy feed for the pigs. The purpose of maintaining and eventually growing the business is to meet the needs of her two children who are still in school.
Erlinda's goal is to nurture her family abundantly in good values, both spiritual and financial.

loan.use: to improve her livestock shelter and buy pig feed.

loan.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 69-year-old married man with eight children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.
The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him, and his dream is to educate his children up to university.
He has operated a retail shop for 20 years now, and his main constraint is inadequate capital to invest in his shop. But his dream is to own a wholesale shop and also buy a motorcycle for transport business so as to increase on his daily income. He intends to get a hired driver to ride the motorcycle, who will remit to Edward 80% of the daily earning.
Edward needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loan.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loan.name: Lem

texts.en: In order to live with a good standard of living such as others in her village, Lem works hard and struggles. She is a farmer. She stays alone which no children. To support her farming business, Lem wishes to borrow $150 in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other related materials.

loan.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other related materials.

loan.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 4 children. Salma has a shop that sells clothes, hair accessories and silver bracelets. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy additional stock like hair accessories & jewelry. Salma has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Salma hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy additional stock like hair, accessories and jewelry

loan.name: Roza

texts.en:
Rose was born and raised in Kazakhstan. She is 52 years old and married with 3 children.
Rosa was born into an ordinary family. She was the eldest child; she had five brothers and sisters. Most of her time was devoted to household chores: looking after younger brothers and sisters, housework, and farm work. As a child, Rosa dreamed of becoming a police officer to protect the innocent and bring justice. After high school, Rose went to military school, then filed documents to apply for a higher education. After graduation, in Soviet times, fate sent Rosa to serve in neighboring Kyrgyzstan, where she met her future husband.
