Thus, in 1988, our heroine got married, and a year later the newlywed had a daughter. Since both husband and wife were in the military, life threw them from place to place in rented apartments.
While her husband served his country, the years passed and the family grew to five people. "We have not had time to look around, and it's time to retire," said Rosa. The couple had been saving for a house for fifteen years, and in 2008 they bought a house in the city center of Karabalta. With the 10,000 som they had left, Rosa decided to buy some products and try to resell them. The first batch went well. Rosa realized that she was able to work in trade and selling in the market. For three years, Rosa has increased her turnover to 60,000 som and was able to pay for tuition at the university for her eldest daughter. To further increase sales and expand the variety of goods she sells, Rose turned to the company Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS). She wants to use proceeds from this money to open more shops.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to increase the variety of goods she offers

loan.name: Rosalyn

texts.en: Rosalyn is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Rosalyn has a shop that sells fish such as sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fish to sell. Rosalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell

loan.name: Denia

texts.en:
Denia is 58 years old and married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.
Denia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Denia requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase a fishing net and to pay for labor.
Denia has been in this business for 20 years. Denia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to purchase a fishing net and to pay for labor

loan.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 48 years of age, married and blessed with four children.
She has managed a hog-raising business for 10 years now. She usually earns PHP 8,000 from selling pigs every four months when they reach full growth. She uses her income to maintain the immediate needs and studies of her children.
Grace is requesting a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase piglets to raise and feed so that she can earn a higher income and save for unexpected emergencies.
She dreams of fully providing for her children's needs in school as they complete their education, which will be serving as the key to a bright future for them.

loan.use: to purchase piglets feed for her pigs.

loan.name: Brenda

texts.en:
Brenda is 36 years old. She is married and has 2 children.
Brenda has a shop that sells frozen foods, like hotdogs & sausage. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy additional frozen foods to sell.
Brenda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Brenda hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy additional frozen foods to sell.

loan.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 59 years old and married. She has 6 children. With 1 child still in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for her children.
Concepcion runs a sari sari store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo and groceries to sell in her sari sari store.
Concepcion has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, milk, curls, bread, egg, etc.
In the future, Concepcion would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy items to sell in her sari sari store.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.
Jessica requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and equipment. Jessica has been in this business for 3 years now, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish.
In the future, Jessica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment.

loan.name: Dulce

texts.en:
Dulce is a widowed woman. She has 4 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Dulce is 54 years old and her children are in school.
Dulce has a business of buying & selling vegetables in the Philippines. Dulce has requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.
Dulce has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, Dulce would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables to sell.

loan.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 3 children.
Divina has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.
Divina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Divina hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loan.name: Ping

texts.en: Mrs. Ping, 32, has been in farming business for over five years ago. She has been living in the Siem Reap Province. She is married woman without a kid even though she has married for a few years. She and her husband always help each other to improve their standard of living. Mrs. Ping is concerned that she faces difficulties in travelling top anywhere. She and her husband always paid for motor taxi when they need to go out their house. To solve the problem, Mrs. Ping has requested a loan to be used to buy a new motorcycle for traveling need in the whole family. With the remainder cash, she will use to enlarge her crop-planting business.

loan.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loan.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is married and has 12 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nelly is 66 years old and has 1 child who is in school.
Nelly has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other equipment.
Nelly has been in this business for 22 years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loan.use: to buy fishing net and other equipment.

loan.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is 63 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.
Anastacia has a shop where she sells snacks, beverages & canned goods. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Anastacia has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anastacia hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.
Jane has a shop that sells fish, like sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy fish to sell. Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Jane hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy fish to sell.

loan.name: Roun

texts.en: Mrs. Roun is a 34 year-old married who make a living by selling some Khmer cakes and other front of her home, Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Roun is blessed with three children, all of them are students and living under her care. She has a life partner in her husband who is a coal seller in the village as well. They are able to make an income from the different occupations in average of $4.25USD. Mrs. Roun will use all percentages of a loan fund to add with her personal saving to construct a new house for her and her familys members to live in as her currently is very old and broken.

loan.use: to construct a new house .

loan.name: Nzega Group

texts.en:
Asma, who is in her early 30s is married with two children who go to school. She's been running a charcoal business for two years now. She works from 7 a.m to 8p.m daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.
This will be her 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more sacks of charcoal, helped with household expenses and she's paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to buy a land.
She will share this loan with her loan group "Nzega" which is comprised of a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loan.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal.

loan.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 1 child.
Rubie has a shop that sells longganisa (spiced meat similar to chorizo) & home-made sausage. She has had this business for 8 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making sausage.
Rubie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, Rubie hopes to improve her business.

loan.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making sausage.

loan.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam is a 39-year-old humble villager who has been living in Siem Reap Province for a long time ago. She and her husband have given birth to two school-aged kids.
Mrs. Sam and her husband are working in the same field at construction sector. Mr. Sams husband is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. Mrs. Sam and husband have been paying money for taxis to get to work because they don't own a vehicle. To solve this trouble, Mrs. Sam and her husband are applying for a loan to purchase a new motorcycle, which will allow them to commute to their work location.
In future plan, Mrs. Sam will buy housing materials for rebuild her old house and to support her children to finish high level of education.

loan.use: to purchase a new motorcycle.

loan.name: Kunduz

texts.en:
Kunduz is 26 years old, married, and has a son and a daughter. Kunduz graduated from pharmacy school and began working at a pharmacy. When she had her son and daughter, she decided find ways to ensure a decent future for them. Since she had experience in trade, in 2008 she decided to open her own pharmacy business. Kunduz leases a shop in Batken Regional Hospital and contracts with local suppliers and producers for medication. Due to the fact that her pharmacy is located within the hospital, the work is non-stop. In order to cover the hours her husband, Turgunbai, helps her, and they work in shifts.
Each year their inventory increases, and Kunduz's communication skills and customer service brings regular customers and helps the business grow. To further develop her business, Kunduz contacted Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). The loan will be used to increase the variety of goods she offers.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to increase the variety of goods she offers.

loan.name: Jean

texts.fr: Jean est commerant, n au Rwanda.et il est le client dACB depuis 2009. Il est mari, il a 38 ans, il a 5 enfants entre 5 ans et 13 ans, et tous vont lcole, Il a 2 ans des tudes secondaire. Cest son troisime cycle de prt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crdit pour acheter 40 cartons deau minral, 20 cartons des savons, 25 cartons des biscuits, 20 cartons de jus de pommes. Il na aucune difficult attendue de non-remboursement de son prt. Sa stratgie pour la croissance de son business est damliorer la qualit des services pour attire la clientle, et accroitre la capacit de son business pour la satisfaction de son clients . Pour ses ambitions il voudrait construire sa propre maison et devenir un grand commerant dans la rgion, et assure lducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Jean is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. He has been a client of ACB since 2009. He is married and 38 years old, and he has five children, aged 5 to 13, all of whom go to school. He has two years of secondary education.
This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to use his loan to buy 40 boxes of water, 20 boxes of soaps, 25 boxes of cookies, and 20 boxes of apple juice. No problems at all are expected in repaying his loan.
His strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service for attracting customers and to grow his business capacity for satisfying his customers. As for his ambitions, Jean would like to build his own house, to become a major merchant, and to ensure his children are educated.

loan.use: to buy 40 boxes of water, 20 boxes of soaps, 25 boxes of cookies, and 20 boxes of apple juice

loan.name: Moth

texts.en: Mrs. Moth, age 38, makes a living by selling fish. She sells the fish that she buys from local fishermen. She currently earns an average of US$3 a day, and she has been running her business for over five years. Her husband is a trailer driver in and around Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Moth is the mother of four teenage children, who are no longer in school. One of children is working as a waitress, and she each contribute some of her incomes to help the family meet its daily expenses. Mrs. Moth is a hard-working woman who never wastes time while engaging in her business activities. As a result of the increasing needs of her clients, Mrs. Moth is applying for a loan so she can purchase more fish to sell and to purchase a motor for picking up her fish.

loan.use: to purchase more fish to sell and to purchase a motor for picking up her fish.

loan.name: Tran's Group

texts.en:
H. was born in 1959. She lives in Ngoc Loi village, Duc Tu commune. She has 4 children, two of whom have a job. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a store. Her main job is farming. Her family has a monthly income of about 10,000,000 Vietnamdong(VND).
H. has participated in SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 1,526,000 VND and has repaid this loan punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy more goods to sell. She is the group leader of this 6 member group loan.
About other borrowers in her group: H. is 27 years old. She has a child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to support her small business. N. is 27 years old. She has a child. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy food for pigs. H. is 45 years old. She has 4 children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to repair her shop. H. is 29 years. She has two children. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy chickens. H. is 28 years old. She wants to borrow 6,758,000 VND to buy chickens.

loan.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy t-shirts & blouses to sell.

loan.name: Jane Njuguini

texts.en:
Jane is 34 years old and married to a businessman. They have two children, 17 and 9 years old.
She runs a clothing sales business at Kayole in Nairobi. She has been in this business for five years now, and she says her major challenge is delayed payments by debtors.
She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy clothes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business to a big boutique and open a tailoring training college.
She sees herself improving her family's living standards and, in the future, building a residential house. She describes herself as humble, patient and God-fearing.

loan.use: to buy more clothes to resell.

loan.name: Pe

texts.en: Mr. Phat is a coco seller for bulk and retail in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia. He is a 31 year old married man. He has three single children who still study and depending on his income. Mr. Phat earns a profit about $4USD per day from his business. His wife is a meat seller in her community and is getting an income about $3USD per day. To increase additional incomes, Mr. Phat concerned that he need some money as a working capital to run a small business by selling a various of products such plastic products, and soft drinks for selling. And with the rest, he also uses to buy a new trailer motorbike for picking up her coco for his regular clients.

loan.use: to run a small business, mix-producing business, and buy a new trailer motorbike.

loan.name: Gulzat

texts.en:
Gulzat is 38 years old. She and her husband, Namazbekom, are raising three children. In 2004, the couple started a business in the meat trade, using 10,000 soms (KGS) as seed capital. Because she was able to develop her business and find regular customers, Gulzat now has average income of 6,000-7,000 soms (KGS). Thanks to the hard work they put into their business, the couple were able to begin construction on a large house for the family.
In order to further improve and expand her business, Gulzat turned to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 120,000 som (KGS) to buy thirty head of sheep and goats. With income from the loan, Gulzat plans to complete construction on her house and save money for university tuition for her children.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to buy sheep and goats

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more shoes to sell.

loan.name: Oeurn

texts.en: Mrs. Oeurn works as a massager staff in one hotel in Siem Reap Province. She always gets a salary in monthly. Her husband is a motor taxi driver, earning an income around $5USD each day to share some responsibility with Mrs. Oeurn in daily expenses. The couple blessed with two children who are young and still studying in local school. Mrs. Oeurn will use a loan in amount of $1,200 in order to change a new motorbike for her husband as his existing motorbike is getting old and buying a new boat for fishing activity.

loan.use: to change a new motorbike and to purchase a new boat for fishing activity.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to increase her stock of shoes to sell.

loan.name: Ama

texts.fr: Revendeuse de pagnes et liqueurs au march de HEDZRANAWOE depuis 2009, Ama est mre de 02 enfants. Elle est son premier cycle de crdit WAGES et sollicite ce montant pour acheter des boissons et pagnes afin de rpondre la demande de la clientle. Son mari est lectronicien.
texts.en: A retailer of pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and liqueurs at the Hedzranawoe market since 2009, Ama is the mother of two children. she is on her first loan cycle with WAGES and is seeking this loan to buy beverages and pagnes in order to respond to her customers' requests. Her husband is an electronics engineer.

loan.use: To buy pagnes (brightly-printed West African clothing) and liqueurs.

loan.name: Keub

texts.en: Mrs. Keub, age 54, is married to Thorn, age 45. She has eleven children, ten of whom are single and one is married and living in dependently. Three of whom are employed in different jobs. For the rest attends school. They always use their own farmland to grow some crop for both rainy season and dry season. Mrs. Keub and her husband can make an income of approximately $4USD each day to help cover the familys expense. Mrs. Keub will be using a loan in a mount of $500 to buy fertilizes and seeds for planting during rainy season coming now.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizes and seeds for planting.

loan.name: Abra

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbons de bois, au march de HEDZRANAWOE, Abra a 57ans. Marie un employ lUniversit de Lom, elle sollicite ce deuxime montant pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois KANTE et ANIE. Elle est maman de 03 enfants et a commenc en 1990.
texts.en: A retailer of charcoal at the Hdzranawo market, Abra is 57 years old. Married to an employee of the University of Lom, she is seeking her second loan to buy bags of charcoal in Kant and Anie. She is the mother of three children and started this business in 1990.

loan.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loan.name: Margaret Wanjiru

texts.en: Margaret is 35 years old, single and has one child who is eighteen years old. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. She has been in this business for three years now and she says her major challenge is financial constraints. Margaret is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy shoes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. She sees herself improving her family's living standards and giving her son a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and committed to her work.

loan.use: Shoes

loan.name: Tohir

texts.en: Tohir lives in Kulob. He is 26 years old. He is married. He lives with his parents. He has a high school education. He has been working in trade for five years. He rents a grocery shop in the Sahovat market. He is taking out a loan to buy oil, chicken legs, and another refrigerator.

loan.use: to buy oil, chicken legs, and another refrigerator.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase a new motto-bike for transporting the vegetables on time.

loan.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Revendeur de lits, de meubles et divers, Kodjo est g de 51ans. Il est mari une revendeuse et sept enfants. Il a commenc cette activit depuis 2001 et se bat du meilleur quil peut pour assurer une bonne ducation ses enfants. Il sapprovisionne Lom et revend au march noir dAkodessewa.il est son premier crdit dans notre institution.
texts.en:
Kodjo sells beds and various types of furniture. He is 51 years old. He is married to a saleswoman and has seven children. He started this business in 2001 and has done the best he can to provide a good education for his children. He gets his supplies in Lom and resells them on the black market in Akodessewa. He is on his first loan with our institution.
Revendeur de lits, de meubles et divers, Kodjo est g de 51ans. Il est mari une revendeuse et sept enfants. Il a commenc cette activit depuis 2001 et se bat du meilleur quil peut pour assurer une bonne ducation ses enfants. Il sapprovisionne Lom et revend au march noir dAkodessewa.il est son premier crdit dans notre institution.

loan.use: to buy furniture and beds for resale.

loan.name: Nhock

texts.en: Mrs. Nhock is 47 years old lives in Siem Reap province. She is married but without children. She and her husband work hard together to support their daily needs. They work together as farmers; rice is their primary crop. Currently, they struggle to grow enough to support themselves as the plowing machine that they use to turn under their rice paddy is old and broken down and they lack money for fertilizer. Mrs. Nhock would like to request a loan from Kiva to repair her plowing machine and purchase seeds and fertilizer. Currently, they make around $3 per day, but she is hopeful that with a loan, they will be able to increase their income and provide better for daily needs.

loan.use: to repair her old plow and buy seeds, fertilizers.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: Handkerchiefs, caps, belts, wallets, toys etc

loan.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Akouvi est ge de 44ans. Elle est marie un menuisier. Elle a quatre enfants.
Elle travaille comme revendeuse de mas et dhuile de coco depuis 1991.Elle sapprovisionne Lom et revend au march dAkodessewa. Elle est son deuxime crdit et souhaite nouveau un crdit pour se rapprovisionner.
texts.en: Akouvi is 44 years old. She is married to a carpenter. She has four children. She has been selling corn and coconut oil since 1991. She gets her supplies in Lom at the market in Akodessewa. She is on her second loan and is hoping to get this money to restock her supplies.

loan.use: to buy corn and coconut oil.

loan.name: Penina

texts.fr: Penina est commerante, n au Rwanda.et elle est marie, elle a 30 ans, elle a 1 enfant de 3 ans, elle a six ans des tudes secondaires. Cest son deuxime cycle de prt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crdit pour renforcer son business de lalimentation. Elle na aucune difficult attendue de non-remboursement de son prt. Sa stratgie pour la croissance de son business est amliore la qualit de service quelle donne et acheter des articles de qualit pour attire la clientle. Pour ses ambitions elle voudrait ouvrir des autres alimentations dans les diffrentes rgions, construire des maisons pour sa famille et payer le minerval de ses enfants et les faire soigner.
texts.en:
Penina is a merchant who was born in Rwanda. She is married and 30 years old, and she has a 3-year-old child. She has six years of secondary education. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. Penina is going to use her loan for bolstering her grocery business. No difficulties at all are expected in repaying her loan.
Her strategy for business growth is to improve the quality of service she provides and to buy quality goods to attract customers. As for her ambitions, Penina would like to open more grocery stores in different regions, to build houses for her family, to cover the school fees for her children, and to take care of them.

loan.use: to bolster her grocery business

loan.name: Hafizakhon

texts.en: Hafizahon lives in the Rudaki district. She is 35 years old. She is married. She has five children. Hafizahon does not have a higher education. She works at home sewing traditional clothes. She has been doing this for three years. She is taking out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loan.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loan.name: Kong

texts.en: To against with the chance and living in good living standard as others, so lots of couples co-operate and try to effort to find which job that suitable to develop economy in family. In the many choices of works, Mrs. Kong and her husband always negotiation with each other for finding solution to progress more revenues in family. Currently, Mrs. Kong is a farmer. Take time from doing farming business, she words as a fish seller around the market and village. She could be made approximately $3 per day. Talk to her husband is a local factory worker in Siem Reap Province of Cambodia.Mrs.Kong wishes to loan in amount of $400 in order to buy a new motorbike.

loan.use: to buy a new motorbike.

loan.name: Helena

texts.pt: Nasceu na localidade de Chamissava, distrito municipal da Catembe a sul de Mocambique no ano de 1971. Cresceu e fez o seu ensino primrio na antiga Escola Missao, porque a familia nao tinha condicoes para continuar a sustentar os seus estudos. Casou se e tem 4 filhos em idade escolar. E, devido a sitiacao economica que nao era satisfatria para a familia, comecou com os negcios muito cedo e vendia diversos produtos. Atraves das amigas teve uma pequena formao na area da avicultura, e dai comecou com a criao de frangos, actividade que vem desenvolvendo ha mais de 4 anos numa capoeira de material precario. Tem larga experiencia nesta actividade, mas o unico problema que na calada da noite varios animais tem invadido a capoeira e comem os pintos assim como os frangos e isto tem criado perdas. Debateu com o marido e decidiram procurar a hluvuku para solicitarem credito no valor de 15.000,00mt para compra de material de construcao ( cimento blocos e outros ) como forma de minimizar riscos de invasao de animais na capoeira. Tem como plano futuro fazer crescer cada vez mais no negocio.
texts.en:
Helena was born in 1971 in Chamissava, which is in the Catembe municipal district in southern Mozambique.She grew up and attended primary school at the old Mission School because her family could not afford to continue paying for her studies.
She got married and has four school-age children. And because her family's economic situation was not satisfactory, she began in business very early and sold a variety of products.
Through friends, she has a little training in aviculture, and she began raising chickens. She has been raising them for more than four years in a poorly built chicken coop.
She has a lot of experience with this activity, but the only problem is that in the dead of night several animals have invaded the coop and eaten the chicks and chickens, so Helena has had losses. She discussed it with her husband, and they decided to ask Hluvuku for a loan of 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (cement blocks, etc.) as a way to minimize the risk of animals invading the coop.
In the future Helena plans to keep her business growing.

loan.use: to buy construction materials (cement blocks, etc.).

loan.name: Uulkan

texts.en:
Uulkan is a 46-year-old farmer who lives in the village of Boz - Karagan. She is married and has raised seven children, the youngest of whom is 17 years old. Uulkan's work in animal husbandry is a tradition, since her family has been farming for several generations. Now on her small farm, Uulkan has two cows, fifteen sheep and three horses. In summer, Uulkan makes about 18,000 Som (KGS) from selling meat and dairy products.
In order to further expand her business, Uulkan contacted Bai - Tushum and Partners for a loan of 130,000 som (KGS). With the money, she intends to purchase twelve calves and cattle to send to summer grazing in the highlands. In the future, Uulkan plans to develop and expand her business.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to purchase cattle

loan.name: Lidia

texts.pt: Nasceu na provnca de Maputo no distrito de Matuituine a 37 anos. Fez o seu ensino primrio na sua terra natal, mudou se para uma outra localidade apenas com 7 anos com seus pais que procuravam melhores condicoes de vida. Parou muito cedo de estudar apenas com nivel primario uma vez que a exigencia antigamente que as mulheres deviam aprender a ser dona de casa para logo que se casassem nao criar deabonos para a nova familia que iria pertencer , dai casou oficialmente donde veio ater 4 filhos com seu marido que era padeiro de profissao. Devido a guerra mudaram se para catembe, para se abrigarem da guerra que se fazia sentir muito na zona sul e houve a necessidade dela trabalhar para ajudar o marido devido a familia que ja era enorme. Com seus fundos proprios conseguiu abrir a sua pequena loja localizada no ponte cais da catembe e atraves de amigas incentivaram lhe a pedir credito para aumentar o seu negocio tendo ja se benefeciado de 4 creditos na hluvuku. Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade (10cxas de refresco,10 de cerveja nacional e 20 cxas de cerveja) Planos para o futuro,ampliar o seu negocio,abrindo mais estabelecimento iisto crescer no seu negocio e para tal vai precisar de mais emprestimos.
texts.en:
Lidia was born in Maputo Province, Matuituine District 37 years ago. She attended primary school in her hometown, and when she was only seven years old she moved to another town with her parents, who were searching for better living conditions.
She quit studying very early, when she had barely finished primary school, because the requirement used to be that women should learn to be housewives so that later when they married, they would not discredit the new family they would belong to. She then got married officially and had four children with her husband, who was a baker.
Because of the war they moved to Catembe. They were seeking shelter from the war, which affected a lot of the southern area, and Lidia needed to work in order to help her husband, because their family was huge. She was able to open a small store on Catembe's pier with her own money, and friends urged her to ask for a loan to expand her business. She has now benefited from four Hluvuku loans.
With the current loan, she intends to buy basic items (10 cases of soft drinks, 10 of domestic beer and 20 cases of beer).
Plans for the future include expanding her business by opening another store. This will help her business grow, and to do it she will need more loans.

loan.use: to buy products (beer, soft drinks, etc.).

loan.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr:
Ayaovi est ge de 30 ans .Elle est marie un commerant. Elle na aucun enfant sa charge.
Ayaovi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009.elle revend de la friperie vers B et sapprovisionne au march de Hedzranawo. Elle a requis son premier crdit WAGES afin dacheter de la friperie.
texts.en: Ayaovi is 30 years old. She is married to a businessman. She doesnt have any children in her care. Ayaovi has been working as a saleswoman since 2009. She sells second-hand clothing in B and gets her supplies at the market in Hedzranawo. She has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to stock up on second-hand clothing.

loan.use: to buy bundles of used clothing.

loan.name: Abagonarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Suavis est une commerante ge de 29ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Elle fait le commerce de bananes et haricot depuis 8ans. Elle est aussi cultivatrice. Elle a fait ses tudes jusquen 5e anne primaire. Elle est marie a Grard ; un cultivateur et ont ensemble 4 enfants dont 1 tudie. Le crdit Kiva quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantits de bananes et haricot revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire ABAGONARIMWE.
texts.en:
Suavis is a 29-year-old merchant who lives in the middle of the country in the city of Gitega. She has been doing commerce in bananas and beans for eight years. She is also a farmer and has a fifth grade education. She is married to Grard, a farmer, and they have four children, of whom one is in school.
The Kiva loan that Suavis is getting will enable her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas and beans for resale in order to make large profits.
She is a member of the community group ABAGONARIMWE.

loan.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas and beans for resale in order to make a large profit

loan.name: Gantsetseg

texts.en: Gantsetseg, age 42, is a seamstress who lives with her husband and 3 children in Ulaanbaatar-the capital city of Mongolia. She makes work wear and suits and sells them at the bazaar everyday. Gantsetseg has had her own business since 1998. Sometimes she needs to hire a sewer part-time to help her in her business. Sometimes she has urgent orders and needs the capital to buy cloth and other supplies. So she is taking a loan which amounts to MNT 1.000.000 to purchase some clothing materials to increase her business production.

loan.use: To purchase some clothing materials to raise business production.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: buy one bundle of children's clothes, three dozen of chains with pendants and one dish of dried okra.

loan.name: Odiljon

texts.en: Odiljon lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 42 years old. He is married. He has four children. His wife is a homemaker. Odiljon has a higher education in economics. He does not work in his profession. He produces pelmeni (meat-filled boiled dumplings similar to ravioli). He rents a place where he opened his small shop. He has been doing this work for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy new equipment. He wants to replace obsolete equipment.

loan.use: to buy new equipment

loan.name: Grace Muthoni

texts.en: Grace is 36 years old, married and has two children ages ten and seven years old. She runs a shoe sales business at Gikomba in Nairobi. Grace has been in this business for ten years and she says her major challenge is financial constraints. She is using her loan of KES 50,000 to buy shoes to sell to the local people. She hopes to grow her business and start importing shoes from abroad. Grace sees herself opening a shoes sales shop in the central business district of Nairobi. She also hopes to buy a plot of land. She describes herself as aggressive and honest.

loan.use: To buy more shoes to sell

loan.name: Isabel

texts.pt: nasceu em Tete no centro de Mocambique no ano de 1972. Cresceu e fez o seu encino primario na vila onde nasceu. Juntou se maritalmente e mae de uma filha. Poque o salario do marido nao cobria com as despesas da casa teve que muito cedo comecar a trabalhar para o sustento da sua familia e dai nunca mais voltou escola. Em busca de melhores condicoes transferiram se para maputo onde esteve a trabalhar por muito tempo como caixa numa ferragem que depois faliu e fechou as portas. Teve que comecar com seus fundos proprios um negocio que podesse alimentar a ela assim como a sua filha menor. Agora ela dona duma de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial onde vende produtos alimentares. Na sua convivencia com vizuinhos ouviu falar da hluvuku onde aproximou e benefeciou se de 4 crditos que os mesmos foram para ampliacao do seu negocio e diversificacao dos produtos.sendo este o seu primeiro emprestimo no espera que com o credito que sera concedido podera comprar produtos tais como refersco,cerveja acucar bolachas e sacos de meixas. Com o credito de 10.000,00mt pretende cpmprar produtos de primeira necessidade. Projectos pessoais para o futuro expandir o seu negocio isto abrindo um bar para a comercializacao de bebeidas mas para tal precisara de outros crditos. Para terminar agradecer apoio dado pela hluvuku- kiva.
texts.en:
Isabel was born in 1972 in Tete, which is in central Mozambique. She grew up and went to elementary school in the town where she was born. She got married and has a daughter. Because her husband's salary did not cover the household expenses, she had to begin working very early to support her family, and so she never returned to school.
Searching for better living conditions, they moved to Maputo, where she worked for a long time as a cashier at a hardware store that later went bankrupt and closed its doors. She had to begin a business with her own money so she could feed herself and her little daughter. Now she is the owner of a small store where she sells groceries. Through her friends, Isabel heard about Hluvuku, which she approached, and she has benefited from four loans. They were for expanding her store, and the first loan was for diversifying her products. With the loan she will receive now, she will be able to buy products like soft drinks, beer, sugar, crackers and sacks of plums. With this 10,000 loan, she will buy basic items.
Isabel's personal projects for the future are to expand this store and open a bar so she can sell drinks, but to do this she will need more loans. Finally, she is grateful for the support Hluvuku and Kiva have given her.

loan.use: to buy and sell products.

loan.name: Vaysidin

texts.en: Vaysidin lives in Sarband. He is 30 years old, married, and he has five children. His wife is a homemaker. Vaysidin works in trade. Near his house he has a grocery store. His son helps him. He is taking out a loan to buy food to stock up because on the eve of the great month of Ramadan demand for his products increases.

loan.use: to buy food

loan.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Prossy has a music studio, which she has had for over 10 years.
To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase sound speakers for music. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Prossy hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Prossy hopes to expand her business. Prossy is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase sound speakers for music.

loan.name: Afi Awefan

texts.fr:
Afi est ge de 27ans. Elle est marie un ingnieur de gnie civil et a un enfant.
Elle est revendeuse de mches et de cartes de recharges depuis 2009 Lom
Elle sapprovisionne au grand march de Lom et au sige de Togo cellulaire pour les cartes de recharge.
texts.en: Afi is 27 years old. She is married to a civil engineer and is the mother of one child. She has been selling hair extensions and recharge phonecards in Lom since 2009. She gets her supply of hair extensions at the great market in Lom and her supply of phonecards at the head office of the phone company "Togo Cellulaire".

loan.use: to buy hair extensions and recharge phonecards.

loan.name: Bakir

texts.ru: Bakir jenat i imeyet 4 detey. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Absheron regione vmeste so svoyey jenoy i lubimimi detmi. Bakir 45 let. On uje 11 let kak rabotayet taxistom. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti dlya pochinki yego taxi. On ochen dobrosovestniy i trudolubiviy chelovek.
texts.en:
Bakir is married and has four children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his wife and beloved children. Bakir is 45 years old.
He has been driving a taxi for eleven years. Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts to repair his taxi. He is a very honest and hard-working man.

loan.use: to repair his taxi

loan.name: Mamadrasul

texts.en: Mamadrasul lives in the town of Qurgan-Tube. He is 53 years old. He is married and has two children. His wife is a housewife, and his sons are in Russia. He has a degree in teaching. He has been trading in the market for more than eight years. He rents a spot where he opened a grocery store. He is taking out a loan to buy candy, sugar, flour, butter and sausage.

loan.use: to buy candy, sugar, flour, butter and sausage.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy construction materials compra de materials (beams, cement and zinc sheets).

loan.name: Elie Yawo

texts.fr:
Elie est un jeune clibataire et sans enfant de 27 ans.
Il est ingnieur de son et pianiste depuis 2010.Pour mieux exercer son travail il sollicite un premier crdit auprs de WAGES pour sacheter une table de mixage.
Il sapprovisionne dans une boutique de la place (ltablissement Gracelec) et exerce son mtier Anfam.
texts.en:
Elie is a young 27-year-old man. He is single and has no children.
He has been working as a sound engineer and pianist since 2010. He gets his supplies in a local shop (Gracelec) and practices his profession in Anfam.
In order to improve his work performance, he is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase a mixing console.

loan.use: to buy a mixing console

loan.name: Bento

texts.pt: Nasceu em xai-xai, distrito de xai-xai,provincia de gaza, tem 30 anos, masculino, tem nivel medio de escolarizao, solteiro vive maritalmente tem residencia fixa na cidade de maputo onde se encontra a familia , tem 3 filhos, 2 raparigas e 1 rapaz,a de 7 anos encontra se a estudar,os outros tem 4anos e 2anos . nao tem outras pessoas a sua responsabilidade . Reside em bela- vista onde se encontra a trabalhar na administracao do distrito de matutuine, tecnico profissional de administracao publica na area de recursos humanos, tem salario de 7.470,00mt, com salario sustenta a familia e faz poupana. Nunca teve emprestimo noutro banco, conheceu a hluvuku agora que esta aqui no distrito este o primeiro emprestimo de 5.000,00mt para vedao do terreno no sector de habitao. tem sonho de construir um centro social para os funcionarios da administracao e o desafio sera falta de bens de garantia que possam cubrir o montante que vai solicitar porque o projecto sera de grande dimenso.
texts.en:
Bento was born in Xai-Xai, in the Xai-Xai district, Gaza province. He is 30 years old and has some post secondary school education. He is unmarried but lives with his partner in the city of Maputo with their family. He has 3 children, 2 girls and a boy. The eldest is 7 and attends school. The other children are ages 4 and 2. He does not support anyone else.
He lives in Bela-Vista where he works in the local goverment of the district of Matutuine. He is a technical professional of public administration working in Human Resources. He earns a salary of 7.470,00mt per month and is able to support his family and save money.
He has never had a loan with another bank. He learned about Hluvuku once he came to this district. This is his first loan, in the amount of 5.000,00mt to be used to fence the property around his home. His dream is to build a community center for people who work in the local government. The challenge will be the lack of property to use as collateral for the amount of money he would request because it would be a large-scale project.

loan.use: to fence the land around his home.

loan.name: Shirukubute Group

texts.fr:
Beatrice est une commerante ge de 30ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Elle fait le commerce darticles divers de boutique comme les savons,dentifrices,produits de beaute pour femmes,les souliers pour enfants depuis 3ans. Elle tait couturire avant de commencer ce mtier. Elle a frquent lcole jusquen 9e anne au niveau de lcole secondaire. Elle est marie et mre de 1 enfant de 2 ans. Le crdit Kiva de 200,000 francs burundais quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantits darticles de boutique(savons,dentifrices,produits de beaute,souliers pour enfants...) revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire SHIRUKUBUTE.
texts.en: Beatrice is a 30 year-old merchant who lives in the central area of the country, in the city of Gitega. She has been trading in various shop articles such as soap, toothpaste, beauty products for women, and childrens' shoes for the past three years. She was a seamstress before she started in this business. She went to school for nine year, up to middle school. She is married and has one child, who is two years old. The Kiva loan of 2000,000 Burundian francs that she is granted will allow her to increase her capital in order to purchase large quantities of shop items to retail, so she can make substantial profits. She is a member of community group Shirukubute.

loan.use: to purchase large quantities of soap, toothpaste, beauty products, childrens shoes, etc for resale in her store

loan.name: Augusto

texts.pt: Nasceu em Matutuine, Provincia de Maputo, tem 28 anos de idade, solteiro, masculino vive maritalmente tem 2 filhas 1 tem 7 anos frequenta a segunda classe e a outra tem 3anos de idade.Esto a sua responsabilidade a av paterna, sua me e 2 irms mais novas tem residencia em Ka tembe Nsime onde se encontra outra parte da familia. Neste encontra se a trabalhar na Sede Distrital do Partido Frelimo Matutuine, como Tecnico de organizao mobilizao e propaganda, tem salario de 8.300,00mt, com o ganha compra alimentos, paga despesas escolares pra familia e poupa algum valor. Nunca teve emprestimos com outros bancos, o primeiro emprestimo na Hluvuku foi de 8.000,00mt-fabrico de blocos o segundo de 12.000,00mt-compra de material de contruo o terceiro tambem compra de material de contruo local para herguer uma casinha em material precario em Bela-Vista o quarto foi pra compra de cama. O actual emprestimo de 22.000,00mt para compra de material de construo. No futuro ele pensa em fazer fomento pecuario na compra de gado bovino para criar, e vai recorer a Hluvuku pra o financiamento.
texts.en:
Augusto was born in Matutuine, Maputo province. He is 28 years old, unmarried but living with his partner with whom he has 2 daughters. One is 7 years old and attends school. The other is 3. He also supports his paternal grandfather, his mother, and two younger sisters who live in Katembe N'sime, where the rest of his family lives.
He works in the district headquarters of the Frelimo Matutuine Party, as a public organizing and propaganda professional. He earns 8.300.00mt which he uses to purchase food, pay for school expenses, for his family, and savings.
He has never had a loan with other banks. His first loan with Hluvuku was for 8.000,00mt to make cement blocks. The second was for 12.000,00mt to purchase construction materials. The third was also to purchase construction materials to build a house of low quality materials in Bela-Vista. The fourth was for the purchase of a bed. This loan is for 22.000,00mt and will be used to purchase construction materials. In the future, Augusto would like to start a cattle business, purchasing and raising cattle. He will work with Hluvuku for the financing.

loan.use: to purchase construction materials (cement block).

loan.name: Anonymous Group
loan.use: to purchase better tires and other spare parts for her taxi.

loan.name: Kangnigan

texts.fr:
Kangnigan est ge de 34ans. Il est mari une revendeuse. Il est papa de trois(03) enfants.
Il est revendeur de glaons et de pure water depuis 2009.Il sapprovisionne Lom et revend kangnikop un quartier de la ville.
Il sollicite ce premier crdit Wages afin dacheter un nouveau conglateur. Il emploie une personne qui laide dans son commerce pour mieux satisfaire la clientle.
texts.en:
Kangnigan is 34 years old. He is married to a saleswoman. He is the dad of three children.
He has been retailing ice and purified water since 2009. He gets his supplies from Lome and resells in Kangnikop, one of the city's districts.
He is requesting this first loan from Wages to purchase a new freezer. He employs one person who helps him in his trade to better satisfy his clients.

loan.use: to purchase a freezer.

loan.name: Niyamaddin

texts.ru: Niyamaddin jivet v Absheron regione. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Niyamaddin 28 let. On etomu biznessu nauchilsya u svoyego otca. Uje 5 let kak on zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin(tak je menyayet maslo tormazov, mashinnoye maslo, maslo matora i t.d)Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit zapchasti i maslo dlya pochinki mashin i razvitiya svoyego biznessa.
texts.en: Niyamaddin lives in the Absheron region. He is single and has no children. Niyamaddin is 28 years old. He started this business with his father. He has been working as a car mechanic for five years. He also changes motor oil, break fluid, engine fluid, etc. Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy parts and oil to repair cars and expand his business.

loan.use: to buy parts and oil to repair cars

loan.name: Jonathan

texts.en: Jonathan is still single and does not have children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for 10 years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future open a shop in the Central Business District. He describes himself as honest, sincere and focused.

loan.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase ladies trousers to sell

loan.name: Nelli

texts.en:
Nelli is 20 years old. She lives in Ijevan city with her parents and her school-aged brother. Nelli has been running her own hairdressing salon for about two years. Before this business, Nelli was engaged in food sales, but in 2009 she changed her business and she hasn't regretted this change.
With the help of her first Kiva loan, Nelli was able to develop her hairdressing salon and now she has a lot of regular clients. Now her business is going very well and thanks to profit from her business, she and her parents decided to open also a small butcher shop. They have already bought a refrigerator and meat chopper and they hope to start their new business very soon. Nelli transferred her hairdressing salon to her home, where she assigned a room for it. So Nelli and her parents set up their new butcher shop in the place of hairdressing salon. Nelli is seeking a loan of 500,000 AMD to buy a shop-window refrigerator for her new butcher shop.

loan.use: To buy a shop-window refrigerator for her new butcher shop

loan.name: Twunguruzanye Group

texts.fr:
Grard est un commerant g de 37ans qui habite au centre du pays dans la ville de Gitega. Il fait le commerce de haricots depuis 6ans. Il est aussi cultivateur. Il a frquent lcole jusquau niveau du primaire. Il est mari et pre de 4 enfants dont 2 tudient a lcole primaire. Le crdit Kiva de quil obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantits de haricots revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Il est membre du groupe communautaire TWUNGURUZANYE
texts.en: Grard is a 37 years old merchant who lives in the central area of the country, in the city of Gitega. He has been in the beans retail business for six years. He also is a grower. He went to school up to the primary level. He is married and a father of four children, two of whom are attending primary school. The 90,000 Burundian francs loan from Kiva he is being granted allows him to increase his capital to purchase large quantities of beans to retail in order to make substantial profits. He is a member of community group "Twunguruzanye."

loan.use: to increase his capital to buy large quantities of beans to retail in order to make substantial profits

loan.name: Steven Muiruri

texts.en: Steven is a married man and they have one child aged four years old whom they wish to give a quality education to the university level. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for two years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy clothes and shoes to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, put up his own business premise where he will not be paying rent. He describes himself as aggressive, clever and humble.

loan.use: to purchase clothes and shoes

loan.name: Tilek

texts.en:
Tilek is an energetic master welder who makes iron gates and grills. He started this business in 1999. He bought the materials he needed to start with 25,000 Som (KGS). Tilek's work became popular and his business is developing successfully. Tilek's passion for his work motivated his younger brother to become a professional welder, making him a reliable assistant. Working hard and producing quality metal products, the brothers were able to find a circle of regular clients and customers, which provide a monthly income of 6,500 som (KGS), .
To increase the range of his products, Tilek has asked Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy iron sheets. With the income from this loan, Tilek plans to build a house and, next year, get married.
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loan.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loan.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is single and has no children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for five years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of KES 20,000 to buy trousers to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers. He hopes to grow his business and in the future, diversify to a transport business. He also sees himself married and taking care of his family. He describes himself as hardworking, honest and resilient.

loan.use: to purchase trousers to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy goods such as rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy beans, green maize, tomatoes to add to her business.

loan.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila, aged 46, is married to Richard. They are blessed with four children: aged between four and 22 years. She operates a salon and beauty shop which has been in operation for eleven years. She earns a monthly income of KES40,000.
This is her first loan with KADET LTD. She will use the loan to buy hair and beauty products for her shop and salon. Petronila will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her daughter, who is in the university. She hopes to start selling second hand clothes in the near future.

loan.use: to buy hair products for her salon/beauty shop.

loan.name: Charles Ndolo

texts.en:
Charles is a single man and does not have any children yet. He runs a clothing sales business at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years now and he says his major challenge is financial constraints. He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy ladies' blouses to grow his business and meet the demands of his customers.
Charles hopes to grow his business and in future open a big boutique in Nairobi Central Business District. He sees himself buying a plot of land and building his own house. He describes himself as humble, intelligent and focused.

loan.use: to buy ladies' blouses

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Rose has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for one year.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family. In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business.
Rose is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loan.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is 49 years old, married with four children aged 19-5 years old. He also looks after his mother. Abubakar owns a permanent house and lives there with five people at Hoima.
For two years, Abubakar has been dealing in the transport business and from it has been able to educate his children. Abubakar faces a challenge of vehicle breakdowns but hopes to get three more vehicles just for transport. He is requesting a loan to top up and buy another vehicle.

loan.use: to buy another car.

loan.name: Barbra

texts.en:
Barbra is 32 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Barbra has a business of a bridal care center, which she has had for six years.
To help expand her business, Barbra has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase bridal dresses for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Barbra hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.
In the future, Barbra hopes to expand her business. Barbra is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase bridal dresses for resale.

loan.name: Girumugisha Group

texts.fr:
Judith est une commerante ge de 30ans qui habite la localit de Mumuri au centre du pays dans la Province de Gitega. Elle fait le commerce de bananes depuis 23ans. Elle tait gardienne de vaches avant de commencer ce mtier. Elle a frquent lcole jusquen 6e anne des tudes primaires. Elle est marie et mre de 7 enfants de dont 3 tudient a lcole primaire. Le crdit Kiva de 200,000 francs burundais quelle obtient lui permet daugmenter son capital pour acheter de grandes quantits de bananes revendre afin de raliser de grands bnfices.
Elle est membre du groupe communautaire GIRUMUGISHA.
texts.en:
Judith is a merchant, 30 years old, who lives in the town of Mumuri, in the middle of the country, in the Province of Gitega. She has been doing commerce in bananas for 23 years. She used to oversee cows before starting in this trade. She attended school through the sixth grade. She is married and the mother of seven children, of whom three are students in primary school.
The Kiva loan of 200,000 Burundi francs that Judith is obtaining will enable her to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas for resale in order to make large profits.
Judith is a member of the community group GIRUMUGISHA.

loan.use: to increase her capital to buy large amounts of bananas for resale

loan.name: Kadijah

texts.en:
Kadijah is 48 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children. Four of her children are currently in school. Kadijah has a business of rental houses, which she has had for two years.
To help expand her business, Kadijah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials to build more rental houses. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Kadijah hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.
In the future, Kadijah hopes to expand her business. Kadijah is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her build more rental houses

loan.use: to purchase materials to build more rental houses.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more shoes.

loan.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Lemprunteuse est une femme qui pratique llevage semi extensif. Elle achte des moutons et des vaches quelle intgre dans le troupeau familial. Ce troupeau est conduit chaque jour en brousse pour paitre. A son retour le soir, elle isole les btes achetes pour leur donner un supplment alimentaire base de rsidus darachide. Elle les revend au bout de six mois .Elle vend galement du lait caill domicile. Lemprunteuse est marie et mre de trois filles et trois garons .Aucun deux ne frquent lcole ; les garons gardent les vaches longueur de journe tandis que les filles soccupent des travaux mnagers. Lemprunteuse est son quatrime prt avec lIMCEC. Elle sollicite un autre prt de 500 000F pour acheter 03 bufs, 04 moutons et 01 chvre dont les produits de la vente l'aideront s'occuper de ses enfants.Elle ambitionne de construire sa propre maison dans la ville.
texts.en:
This borrower is a woman who raises livestock semi-extensively. She purchases sheep and cows and adds them to the family herd. This herd is driven each day to the bush to feed. Then, in the evenings, she separates the purchased animals and gives them extra feed made from peanut refuse. At the send of six months, she sells them. She also sells curdled milk out of her house.
This borrower is married and the mother of three girls and three boys. None of them attend school; the boys keep watch over the cows all day long, while the girls take care of the housework.
This borrower is on her fourth loan with the micro-finance institution IMCEC. She is requesting another loan of 500,000 francs to buy 3 head of cattle, 4 sheep, and a goat. Selling them will help her to take care of her children. Her ambition is to build her own house in town.

loan.use: to buy 3 head of cattle, 4 sheep, and a goat

loan.name: Dthi

texts.fr: Lemprunteur est un jeune mari il ya seulement six mois. Il tient une boutique de vente de produits cosmtiques au bord de la route nationale qui traverse sa localit. Avec les bnfices tirs de son commerce, il a ouvert un magasin de vente de produits alimentaires et a ralis un verger dans lequel il fait du maraichage, de lembouche bovine et y a plant des arbres fruitiers.Cette diversification de ses revenus est du au fait que malgr sa jeunesse, il supporte seul toutes les charges dentretien de la famille qui est assez large. Sa gnrosit fait quil est trs sollicit dans sa ville ou le chmage et le sous emploi sont trs important. Il na jamais pris de prt lIMCEC. Il demande aujourdhui prt de 400 000F pour complter ses fonds et acheter un vhicule qui facilitera beaucoup ses activits.Son ambition est de se transformer en grossiste pour approvisionner les dtaillants de sa localit.
texts.en:
This borrower is a young man who was married only six months ago. He has a shop selling cosmetics along the national road, which crosses his town. With the profits derived from his business, he opened a store selling grocery items. And he has a established an orchard where he cultivates a market garden, fattens cattle, and plants fruit trees. This diversification of his revenues is because, despite his young age, he is responsible for covering by himself all the expenses of his family, which is fairly large.
His generosity means that much is asked of him in his city, where unemployment and under-employment are very high.
He has never taken out a loan with IMCEC. Today, he is asking for a loan of 400,000 to round out his funds and to buy a vehicle for facilitating a lot of his work. His ambition is to become a wholesaler to supply the retailers in his town.

loan.use: to buy a vehicle

loan.name: Ndone

texts.en:
Ndone is a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have one child aged five years old. He runs a restaurant at Mutindwa in Nairobi. He has been in this business for four years now and employs one person. He says that this business is profitable and the challenge he has is financial constraints.
He is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy food items to grow his business and meet the demand of his customers. He hopes to grow his business to a big hotel. He also hopes to give his child a good education to university level. He describes himself as honest, humble and courageous.

loan.use: to buy more food items.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy basins, mugs, plates, buckets to add to her business.

loan.name: Ndiaga Mahtar

texts.fr: L'emprunteur tient une boutique de vente de denres alimentaires dans son village. Il s'approvisionne en ville 15 km et a russi attirer une importante clientle dans les villages environnants du fait de sa bonne crdibilit. Il assure avec les bnfices gnrs par son activits l'essentiel des besoins de sa famille.Pour augmenter son fonds de commerce et satisfaire la forte demande, il sollicite un prt e 400 000F pour acheter 15 sacs de riz et 100 litres d'huile. Il ambitionne de transformer sa boutique en magasin de vente en gros pour approvisionner les boutiques des villages de la zone.
texts.en: The borrower manages a grocery store in his village. He gets his supplies from the city, 10 miles away, and has succeeded in attracting a large clientele from neighboring villages due to his good credibility. With the profits generated by his business, he provides for most of his family's needs. To increase his working capital and satisfy the strong demand, he is requesting a 400,000 XOF loan, with which to purchase 15 bags of rice and 100 liters of cooking oil. His ambition is to turn his shop into a wholesale store to supply the grocery stores in his area.

loan.use: to buy 15 bags of rice and 100 liters of cooking oil.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 48 years old. She is a single mother of four children aged between twenty-two years old and three years old whom she hopes to give a good education to the university level. She runs a restaurant in a residential area in Kitengela. She has been in this business for ten years now. She says that this business is profitable and the challenge she has is financial constraints.
Josephine is using her loan of Kes 80,000 to buy food items and renovate the business premises to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a big hotel where she will be making an income of Kes 90,000 per month. She describes herself as visionary.

loan.use: to buy food items and pay for renovations.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy more vegetables, tomatoes and potatoes for his business.

loan.name: Mukaram

texts.en: Mukaram lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 53 years old. She is divorced and has four children. Her son works as a day laborer in construction. Mukaram makes a living by breeding cattle. She breeds cattle for sale. She has been doing this for three years. SHe is taking out a loan to purchase cattle.

loan.use: to buy cattle

loan.name: Yudaya

texts.en:
Yudaya is 43 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has six children. All of her children are currently in school. Yudaya has a business making half bricks, which she has had for two years.
To help expand her business, Yudaya has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase another machine that makes half bricks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Yudaya hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.
In the future, Yudaya hopes to expand her business. Yudaya is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her improve her business.

loan.use: to purchase another machine that makes half bricks.

loan.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has five children. Three of her children are currently in school. Betty has a business of rental houses, which she has had for 10 years.
To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials like cement to complete some rental houses. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Betty hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.
In the future, Betty hopes to expand her rental houses. Betty is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her standard of living.

loan.use: to purchase materials like cement to complete some rental houses.

loan.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 43 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children. Six of his children are currently in school. Fred has a furniture business that makes beds, which he has had for 10 years.
To help expand his business, Fred has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase lumber for making beds for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Fred hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.
In the future, Fred hopes to expand his business. Fred is a member of Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped his prospects for the future by improving his standard of living.

loan.use: to purchase lumber for making beds for resale.

loan.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is 35 years old. She is married and they have three children aged between fourteen years old and five years old whom they hope to give a good education to the university level. She runs a little restaurant in a residential area in Nairobi. She has been in this business for one year now. She says that this business is profitable and the challenge she has is financial constraints.
Caroline is using her loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy food items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers. She hopes to grow her business to a big hotel. She says her dream is to become a millionaire in future. She describes herself as God-fearing, aggressive and committed.

loan.use: to buy food items

loan.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. Sarah has a small retail shop selling goods such as sugar, which she has had for two years.
To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sarah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.
In the future, Sarah hopes to expand her business. Sarah is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase essential commodities.

loan.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school. Rose has a beauty salon, which she has had for seven years.
To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase braids for the hair for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Rose hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.
In the future, Rose hopes to expand her business. Rose is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase braids for the hair for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to buy sheep, goats, and chickens to add to his business.

loan.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Jane has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for three years.
To help expand her business, Jane has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jane hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Jane hopes to expand her business into a wholesale business. Jane is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loan.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 33 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has two children. Both of her children are currently in school. Sylvia has a business growing mushrooms, which she has had for two years.
To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase fertilizers and other items to improve the mushrooms. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Sylvia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Sylvia hopes to expand her business. Sylvia is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by living a good life.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and other items to improve the mushrooms

loan.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 1 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe set compos de 5 femmes vendeuses qui habitent dans un village. elles achtent en groupage de l'arachide pour en faire de la transformation en produits locaux (huile, aliments de btails...).elles bnficient d'une exprience de plus de 5 ans dans la transformation et dispose d'une bonne clientele. ce financement leur permettra d'augmenter leur fond de roulement, et d'entretenir et payer le scolarit de ses enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of five businesswomen who live in the same village. They buy peanuts as a group to make them into local products (oil, livestock fodder, etc.). They have more than five years of experience in this business and have attracted a good clientele. This loan will permit them to grow their working capital, care for their children and pay their children's school fees.

loan.use: to buy peanuts.

loan.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 48 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is widowed and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Joyce has a small retail shop that sells sugar, which she has had for three years.
To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Joyce hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. In the future, Joyce hopes to expand her business. Joyce is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar and salt to sell

loan.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 36 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are currently in school. Florence has a business selling food like "matooke" (green bananas), which she has had for three years.
To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for her family.
In the future, Florence hopes to expand her business. Florence is a member of BRACs Small Enterprise (SEP) Program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase food for resale.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy goats, sheep, and chickens

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for his farm

loan.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 2 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est compos de 5 femmes vendeuses, leur activit principale est l'achat et la vente de mangue. elles maitrisent l'activit et bnficient d'une bonne clientele. Ces femmes ont une marge bnficiaire de 50 pour cent de leur chiffre d'affaire. Avec ce fiancement elle verront leur niveau de vie augmenter et de pouvoir soutenir leur mari dans les depenses quotidienne de la maison
texts.en:
This group is composed of five businesswomen whose main activity is buying and selling mangoes.
They are good at their business and have the advantage of having a good clientele. These women have a profit margin of 50 % of their turnover. With this loan they will improve their living conditions and be able to help their husbands with daily household expenses.

loan.use: to buy mangoes.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy timber, nails and a hack saw to increase his income

loan.name: Safina

texts.en:
