Safina is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children. One of her children is currently in school. Safina has a business selling charcoal, which she has had for two years. She has a second business roasting maize.
To help expand her business, Safina has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Safina hopes to generate greater profits and buy new clothes for herself.
In the future, Safina hopes to own a small retail shop that sells sugar. Safina is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by improving her business.

loan.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loan.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 43 years old, married to Kareauki. They are blessed with six children ages sixteen, fourteen, twelve, ten, eight and six years. He has been keeping livestock for the past six years with a monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family members.
He is applying for his second loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan to buy goats, cows, sheep and chicken to grow his business.
With the anticipated profit from the business he will buy a piece of land for grazing the livestock. His hopes and dreams are to educate his children amd buy a piece of land for developing.

loan.use: To buy goats, cows, sheep and chicken to grow his business

loan.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Graces group is comprised of four hard-working young women. Grace is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kasubi in the Kampala Central region of Uganda. She is single and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. Grace has a small restaurant which she has had for two years.
To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase food for for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Grace hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.
In the future, Grace hopes to build a house. Grace is a member of BRACs Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save and be hard-working.

loan.use: to purchase food for the restaurant.

loan.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 39 years old and is married to Beatrice. They are blessed with four children; ages eighteen, fourteen, ten and five years. He has a hotel business which he has been doing for three years with a monthly income of KES 12,000 which he uses to support his family members.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to purchase more stock of rice, flour, vegetables, cooking oil and charcoal.
With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children and use the rest as working capital. His hopes and dreams are to purchase land, build rental houses, and purchase a motorcycle.

loan.use: to purchase more stock of rice, flour, vegetables, cooking oil and charcoal.

payment.comment: Over-reported by partner. Reduced to local price.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase oil, rice, flour, sugar, and baking-powder

loan.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 42 years old and married to John. They are blessed with four children ages twenty, eighteen, fifteen and ten years old. She has been running a retail shop for six years with a monthly income of KES 8,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan from KADET after being introduced by the KADET staff. She will use the loan to add to her stock of sugar, rice, and wheat flour for his shop.
With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children and buy goats to raise. Her hope and dream is to open a wholesale shop and a hardware shop.

loan.use: To add sugar, rice, and wheat flour to her shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy goats, sheep and donkeys to sell

loan.name: Erastus

texts.en:
Erastus is 31 years old and married to Mawia. They are blessed with three children, ages 10, 7, and 3. He has been a shopkeeper for the past eleven years. He earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add inventory of cooking fat and wheat flour maize meal in his shop.
With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children and provide for his family's needs. His hopes and dreams are to purchase some land, build a house, and purchase his own vehicle.

loan.use: To purchase cooking fat and wheat flour maize meal for his shop

loan.name: Rhoda

texts.en:
Rhoda is 32 years old and married to Musyoka. They are blessed with three children ages 10, 8 and 4 years old. She has been running a retail shop for nine years with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family.
She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. She will use the loan to add sugar, maize meal and rice to her retail shop.
With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children, expand her business and start livestock farming. Her hopes and dreams are to purchase land and build rental houses, which will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loan.use: To buy sugar, maize meal and rice to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy rice, sugar and cooking fat for her shop

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase more welding metals, plain sheets and welding accessories.

loan.name: Tutugirl

texts.en: Tutugirl is 33 years old and lives in the airport community. She stopped her education in the 4th grade. She is married and has three children between 7 and 15 years old who are in school and live at home. Hr husband has been a contractor (building ) for the past 10 years. She has been selling oil, rice, pepper and charcoal. She started this business with charcoal and learned it from her mother. She is requesting a loan to purchase oil, rice, pepper, and charcoal, for her business. She likes her business because it enables her to take care of her family. Her plan is to buy land and build a house.

loan.use: to purchase oil, rice, pepper, and charcoal

loan.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 49 years old and married to Phyllis. He has been running a motorcycle taxi as his primary business and hawking milk as his secondary business for two years with a monthly income of KES.10,000, which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to service his motorbike to help him supply milk to different places.
With the anticipated profit from the two businesses, he will educate his children. His hopes are for them continuing their education up to the university level.

loan.use: To service his motorbike

loan.name: Bokk Jom Taiba Mbaye 3 Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est compos de 5 femme vendeuse, elles ont une exprience de plus de 7 ans dans le commerce. leur activit principale est l'achat d'arachide pour la transformation de produits locaux (huile, aliment btail etc ). leur lieu de vente est le march du village. Ce groupe dispose d une bonne clientele, ce qui leur permettra avec ce financement de voir une augmentation de revenu. DE puvoir pendre en charge la scolarit de leurs enfants.
texts.en: This group is composed of five businesswomen who have more than seven years of experience in commerce. Their main activity is buying peanuts to transform into local products (oil, livestock fodder, etc.) They make their sales in the village marketplace. This group has a sizeable clientele which, given this loan, will permit them to increase their incomes and be responsible for paying school fees for their children.

loan.use: to buy peanuts.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To purchase goats, sheep and cattle

loan.name: Grace Nyabeta

texts.en:
Grace is 40 years old, married, and has three children aged between sixteen years old and seven years old. She operates a small retail business selling sugar, flour, cooking oil, detergents, beverages, kerosene and other items.
Grace has been running this business for two years now. She says that the business is profitable and the only major challenge she has is financial constraints.
She is using her loan of Kes. 20,000 to add to her stock of flour, sugar, cooking oil, kerosene and other items to grow her business and meet the demand of her customers.
In the future, she hopes to expand her business into wholesale. She also hopes to give her children a good education to the university level. She describes herself as honest and religious.

loan.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil, flour and kerosene.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy vegetables and potatoes to sell

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: To buy sugar, wheat flour and a television set for his hotel

loan.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 24 years old and married to Patricia. They are blessed with one child aged one year. Paul has been running a restaurant for the past year with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family.
He is applying for his first loan with KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to add a stock of cooking oil, wheat flour and purchase a television set for his restaurant.
With the anticipated profit from his business he will construct his own house and relocate his family. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and construct a big restaurant in his home town.

loan.use: To add a stock of cooking oil, wheat flour, and purchase a television set.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase slippers and clothes for her business.

loan.name: Imelda

texts.es: Imelda tiene 61 aos, su actividad es brindar el servicio de transporte de triciclo y tambin tiene su agencia de servicios de viajes. Hace ms de 5 aos que tiene este negocio, el negocio de la agencia lo heredo de su esposo quien falleci y fue con la ayuda de este negocio que invirti en la compra de triciclos y brindar este servicio que le generara ganancias ella tiene a una persona que trabaja diariamente y le entrega una parte del dinero y la otra parte que le corresponde a Imelda. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de un triciclo que se encuentra en buen estado.
texts.en: Imelda, 61, provides transportation services in a three-wheeled vehicle; she also has a travel agency. Shes had the business for over 5 years. She inherited the travel agency from her husband when he died and support from this business helped her purchase the three-wheeled vehicles to provide this new service that generates profits for her. She has an employee that works for her daily and part of what is earned goes to Imelda. She is asking for the loan to buy a three-wheeled vehicle thats in good condition.

loan.use: to buy a three-wheeled vehicle.

loan.name: Fortune

texts.en:
This borrower is a 41-year-old Rwandan entrepreneur with three children between 2 and 9 years old. The older two are in school, and her husband is a driver.
For the past seven years she has owned a general store selling various goods such as mineral water, sugar, and beans. This business has enabled her to feed her family and develop herself and her familys standard of living.
She will use this loan to reinvest in her general store and buy various items such as rice and sugar.
With additional profits she will buy a piece of land.

loan.use: to buy items such as rice, sugar, beans, etc. for sale.

loan.name: Reyna Aquilina

texts.es: Reyna Aquilina tiene 40 aos con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar a su familia adelante. Y surgi con la necesidad de sufragar los gastos de su hogar, El negocio lo aprend desde la edad de 12 aos con su mama ya que en vida se dedicaba a la misma actividad. Ya de forma independiente tengo aproximadamente 16 aos de ejercerlo, como madre soltera tena que buscar los recursos para mantener a mis hijos y mi hogar. Ella espera muy pronto proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda, para que sus hijos puedan vivir con las condiciones necesarias. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, perfumes, cremas, calzado, bolsos, tratamientos entre otros.
texts.en:
Reyna Aquilina is 40 years old and with much effort she has been able to advance her family. All of a sudden, she faced the necessity of paying for the family's expenses. She had learned about business at the age of 12 from her mother, who while alive carried out the same activity.
Independently, Reyna has 16 years doing this. As a single mother she had to find resources to maintain her children and her home. She hoped to quickly provide improvements in the home, so her children could live under proper conditions.
The loan she solicits is for working capital to buy clothing, perfumes, creams, shoes, purses, and treatments, among other things, to sell.

loan.use: buy clothing, perfumes, creams, shoes, purses, and treatments, to sell.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase plantain and peppers to sell

loan.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Maria Mercedes tiene 32 aos, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadera en general. Hace ms de 7 aos que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que siempre le ha gustado. Ella dio inicio por su esposo, con las ganancias el obtena empezaron a compra pocos productos y fueron obteniendo cada das ms, ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo por los que tiene que velar todos los das. Maria tiene toda la fortaleza para salir adelante por lo que cada da fue ganando clientes y con la confianza que les brinda todo se hace mucho ms fcil para ofertarles lo que desean. Solicita este financiamiento para la compra de ropa, joyas, cosmticos, cremas, colonias y calzado.
texts.en: Mara Mercedes, 32, is a young woman selling general merchandise. Shes been in business over 7 years and has always enjoyed it. She started thanks to her husband. With profits he earned they started buying a few products and continued to obtain more each day. She has three children in her care so she has to watch them every day. Mara has all the strength needed to get ahead so shes been winning over customers daily and because of the trust she inspires in them selling what they want to them becomes so much easier. Shes asking for this loan to buy clothes, jewelry, cosmetics, creams, colognes and shoes.

loan.use: to buy general merchandise.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase slippers for her business.

loan.name: Jos Fernando

texts.es:
Jos es un padre soltero de 26 aos que vive en el cantn de Santo Domingo, su pequeo hijo tiene tres aos de edad y actualmente asiste a un centro educativo.
Aos atrs pas por una mala racha, estuvo desempleado por un tiempo pero hoy en da Jos se dedica a vender a los bazares productos naturales desde hace 8 aos, esto lo aprendi gracias a la recomendacin de una amiga. No cuenta con movilizacin propia por lo que llevar grandes cajas es una tarea difcil. Muy temprano en la maana en comienza su jornada, ya que debe empezar con el oficio de ser padre. Procura terminar todas sus actividades lo antes posible para as dedicarle tiempo a su hijo quien es su razn de ser. Jos quiere invertir en mercadera por lo que acudi a Fundacin Alternativa en busca de un crdito.
Su gran meta es dar a su hijo una educacin completa, verlo crecer feliz y poder darle una vida digna. Con este crdito el quiere mejorar su calidad de vida, l suea con tener un auto para facilitar su trabajo y poder tener ms ingersos.
texts.en:
Jos is a 26 year old single father who lives in the Santo Domingo settlement. His young son is three years old and attends a preschool.
Years ago, because of bad luck, he was unemployed for some time, but now Jos sells organic products at local bazaars and has been doing so for eight years. He learned this, thanks to the recommendation from a friend. He doesnt have his own transportation, so moving large boxes is difficult. He begins his work early in the morning, because his fatherly duties come first. He tries to finish everything as soon as possible so that he can devote more time to his son, who is his reason for being. Jos wants to invest in merchandise, so he approached Fundacin Alternativa for a loan.
His greatest goal is to provide a complete education for his son, watch him grow happy, and be able to give him a dignified life. This loan will help him to improve his quality of life. His dream is to have a car to make transportation easier and help him generate more income.

loan.use: to buy merchandise for resale.

loan.name: Ssuubi Development Association Group

texts.en:
From the very beginning, 50-year-old Mary stressed to her workers the need for diligence if her poultry business was to have good prospects. She wanted her business to be reckoned among the best in the metropolis of Kampala. Once she zeroed in on what gives this genre of business a vantage point, she went to every length to see to it that she purchases more bags of chicken mash, medicine and layer chickens.
That was her way of making a statement that she was in for the long haul and that she wanted to make quick headway. Though her journey from the start was fraught with many challenges like the lack of financing for the purchase of more chickens, she nevertheless obtained a footing.
The way she has organised and planned for her business the last 10 years bears all the hallmarks of success.
Mary is to all appearances a buoyant and assiduous lady. She is happily married with eight high-spirited kids. She says the inspiration before she took root in this business came from her close friends.
On the side, she ekes out additional income from two other businesses--bricks sales and rentals.
This Kiva loan, Mary says, will be used to purchase more layer chickens and chicken mash and she says she will use the rest to pay fees for her kids.

loan.use: to purchase more layer hens, chicken mash, and use the rest of the loan to pay fees for her kids.

loan.name: Anonymous
loan.use: to purchase flour, sugar, baking powder, yeast and oil for the business.

loan.name: Olga Marie Adelade

texts.fr:
Femme mari de 44ans et mre de quatre enfants dont l'ge varient de 17 25ans dont trois sont scolariss.A la fin de sa classe de troisime elle se lance dans la vente des objets plastiques avec un capital de 125.000 frs en 1996.ses ventes journalires varient de 15000 40000frs.
Avec ce prt elle va renforcer son activit en achetant des ustensiles en plastiques tel que des cuvettes, des paniers, des gobelets, des seaux et des paniers a linge.Elle s'approvisionne dans les grands marches de la capitale et parfois a Kinshasa
Elle a pour stratgie de vendre des prix favorables, afin de favoriser les achats de ses clients a proximite de leurs habitations . Pour l'avenir , elle pense beaucoup epargner et faire des gros benefices pour assurer l'avenir de ses enfants et leur scolarite.
texts.en:
This lady is 44 years old with four children between 17 and 25 years old, three of whom attend school. In 1996, after third grade, she began selling plastic goods, using startup capital of 12,000 FRS. Today, her daily takings range from 15,000 to 40,000 FRS.
She would use this loan to boost her business by purchasing plastic kitchen utensils such as bowls, baskets, cups, buckets and laundry baskets. She sources her goods from the capital's main markets and sometimes from Kinshasa. Her strategy is to sell at reasonable prices to draw in customers from their nearby homes. In the future she would like to generate significant profits and put some savings aside in order to provide for her children's future and education.

loan.use: to purchase plastic kitchen utensils, bowls, baskets, cups and buckets

loan.name: Fight Against Shame Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the For against Shame group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, northern Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of SLL 500,000 for each member to improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.
Isatu is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Port Loko, northern Sierra Leone. A widow, Isatu has six children. One of her children is in primary school, two are in secondary school, one is in college and the others are no longer attending school.
Isatu sells clothes for both men and women. She has been doing this business for 10 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu is going to buy both men and womens clothes in bulk to add to her business.

loan.use: to buy men and womens clothes in bulk
